description: Dry and crisp in acidity, with a silky texture, this is a polished Pinot Noir for drinking now. It has a rich array of cherry pie and sweet oak flavors, with earthier notes of pomegranate and cola.
title: Arista 2010 Two Birds Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The cherry, red currant, cola and oak flavors are delicious on this bone-dry Cab. Structuraly, however, the wine is so soft that the palate searches in vain for firmness and grip to complete the flavor experience.
title: Heibel Ranch 2010 GBH Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Pretty basic, a dryly tannic red wine with cherry and herb flavors. Feels hard and sharp in the mouth, with astringent tannins and acids. Could age out.
title: Viansa 2007 Athena Dolcetto (Sonoma County)

description: This single vineyard selection is softly herbal, with peppery strawberry fruit. The finish leaves an impression of water crackers.
title: Oak Knoll 2012 Tuenge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: It is amazing that 134,000 cases of this budget bottling can be made to this level of quality. From a classic vintage, it's structured and substantial, overcoming the somewhat overdone vanilla flavors with great fruit and firm acids.
title: Columbia Crest 2006 Two Vines Merlot-Cabernet (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Scurati Nero d'Avola delivers easy tones of red fruit and cherry, with slight shadings of tobacco and wet earth. There is an herbal note as well, and the mouthfeel is vibrant and fresh.
title: Ceuso 2010 Scurati Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: With overpowering pineapple and almost a flinty quality to its aroma, this wine is simply sweet.
title: Rock Wall 2009 Viognier (Mendocino County)

description: Lemon zest, citrus blossoms and peach aromas lead the way to tropical fruit flavors in this Romanian Pinot Grigio. It is light bodied with a crisp finish.
title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreambird Pinot Grigio (Romania)

description: Nutty aromas of almond skins and walnut aren't terribly fruity but show some mineral cut. The wine is punchy but standard in feel, with a mix of citrus and melon flavors. The finish tastes nutty and a bit briny.
title: Salentein 2012 Reserve Chardonnay (Uco Valley)

description: Steady, firm and tonic, this offers an informal bouquet of citrus and stone fruit followed by steely effervescence and fresh acidity. This Prosecco should pair with fried calamari or grilled shrimp.
title: Borgo Magredo 2010 Brut Millesimato  (Prosecco)

description: Based in Bué, one of the top villages of Sancerre, this producer has made a ripe, crisp and nervy wine that comes from chalk soil. Tangy with a mineral texture, it offers rich currant and lime flavors and full-throated final acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Franck Millet 2014  Sancerre

description: This wine features a melding of concentrated fruit, toasty oak and toffee notes, especially on the finish, which is similarly ringed in smoky oak. It's a meaty Cabernet Sauvignon out of Lodi, with a touch of burnt ember reminiscent of a campfire.
title: Mettler Family Vineyards 2009 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: A bit tart, with a bite that comes from irregular tannins and zesty acidity. Yet it's dry and elegantly silky, with good cherry, berry, cola and spice flavors. Give it a good decant.
title: Vine Hill 2008 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is aged in 100% new American oak, putting tight berry and cassis flavors behind plenty of dried herb notes and astringent tannins. Fine for drinking with a thick steak, but not so much for sipping on its own.
title: Barons V 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Very soft and easy going, this has rounded peach and apple flavors. The acidity is light, hinting at citrus. Screwcap.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Storks Landing White (Lisboa)

description: Neutral aromas and a light pink color suggest this will be an easy ride. Its shy palate is light on acidity, with generic, mild flavors and a mildly briny finish.
title: Beronia 2016 Tempranillo Rosado (Rioja)

description: White orchard-fruit aromas, like slow-cooked green apples and Barlett pears, are offset by flower and light spice accents. The palate is a little broad, but the wine finishes with a lemony, minerally tang.
title: Trump 2011 Viognier (Monticello)

description: This is a chewy, thick and -savory wine, with layers of smoked meat, cola, soy sauce, tobacco and black spice. The fruit here recalls jammy blackberries and dried cassis.
title: Gualandi 2005 Orciatico Red (Rosso di Toscana)

description: This Bordeaux blend from New Jersey has appropriate aromas and flavors of dark berry, cedar, tobacco and spice, but it lacks the dimension and muscularity that makes this type of blend memorable. Still, it's a pretty wine and will pair well with numerous meat and fowl dishes.
title: Unionville 2004 Hunter's Red Reserve Meritage Red (New Jersey)

description: Hints of fresh mint leaves highlight the brooding black currant and dark fruit aromas. The balance of Cabernet and Merlot has been successfully achieved, as the wine is beautifully structured with a firm backbone of ample tannins and a rich, supple mouthfeel.
title: Barons Edmund Benjamin de Rothschild 2003 Kosher  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Pushy aromas include minty oak, shoe polish and foxy plum and berry. There's a lot of forward oak, warmth and ripe fruit.
title: Santa Luz 2011 Reserva Encinos Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)

description: The wine has a bitter edge with a burnt character that clashes with the red fruit and banana flavors. Maybe better in a few months, but by then, of course, it will have been drunk.
title: Albert Bichot 2011 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: A grippy, ink-staining, concentrated Charbono from the Santa Clara Valley, made from 90% estate-grown Charbono (the vineyard is in San Martin) and 10% Syrah. Two years spent in French oak might explain its minty, cedar highlights, rounded out by black cherry and plum.
title: Fortino 2007 Charbono (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Fresh grass, vibrant citrus and tart gooseberry fill the nose and mouth, making this an approachable and clean white perfect for pairing with lighter chicken and fish dishes. 70% Chenin Blanc and 30% Sauvignon Blanc; drink now.
title: Stellenbosch Hills 2010 Polkadraai Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Polkadraai Hills)

description: A decent Merlot that shows berry and cola fruit flavors, with a touch of oak and beautiful tannins. It's a little hot and funky. Not going anywhere, so drink up.
title: Barlow 2007 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Made from Zinfandel, Carignane, Petite Sirah and Mataro (Mourvèdre), this hearty wine currently is sweet and full in primary cherry, blackberry, plum and cedar flavors, with a touch of raisins in the finish. It should slowly develop over the next 4–6 years before heading inexorably downhill.
title: Ridge 2007 Geyserville Red (Sonoma County)

description: The fruit is fresh and crisp with a lightly perfumed floral character, its pear and green apple flavors still young. It needs a couple of years more to fully blend together.
title: Dopff & Irion 2005 Millésime L'Exception Brut Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: This semi-dry rosé offers strawberry, rhubarb and a touch of medicinal spice on the nose, followed by strawberry and sweet cherry on the palate. A hint of spice livens things.
title: Vaeni NV Makedonikos Rosé Semi-Dry Wine Rosé (Macedonia)

description: A very shy nose leads onto a fresh palate where frothy bubbles reveal a hint of tart red-currant fruit and fresh citrus. The body is very light and dry, but has a zesty, mouthwatering finish.
title: Domaine François Schmitt NV Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Delicious scents of honey, apples and petrol lead to a luscious, full-bodied palate full of smoke and honey with a gripping lime skin astringency on the finish. Rich in honey tones, yet quite dry, the palate is balanced with a bracing acidity.
title: Château Bela 2008 Riesling (Muzla)

description: Slightly sweet and quite light in body, this wine has modest peach and herb aromas, generic fruit flavors and a soft texture.
title: Bota Box 2015 Riesling (California)

description: Thin and green flavors dominate this Cabernet Franc. Small amounts of Merlot and Petit Verdot do not seem to have made an impact. It's sharp, stiff, and quite herbal.
title: Capstone Cellars 2009 Boushey Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: Leafy, spicy berry aromas open up with airing. This is medium in body, with chewy tannins. Fresh plum and red-berry flavors come with plenty of oak, toast and pepper. This finishes with a persistent spicy toastiness.
title: Junta 2013 Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (Curicó Valley)

description: This blend of Greco and Fiano shows a dry note of crushed mineral, followed by notes of peach, honey and a touch of spice and lemon zest. Pair this with Thai mango salad.
title: Vigneti del Vulture 2011 Pipoli White (Basilicata)

description: At 70% Garnacha and 30% Tempranillo, this hold-over from the sketchy 2002 harvest starts with an odd blend of clove and shaved wood notes, while the palate pushes basic cherry and tangy raspberry flavors.
title: Valle Rojo 2002 Crianza Grenache-Tempranillo Red (Cariñena)

description: This is a light and simply fruity wine, showing lively acidity and black currant fruit tones. It is soft on the palate and only lightly disturbed by a dry tannic background. Drink now.
title: Casa Cadaval 2012 Vinha Padre Pedro Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This wine's nose is restrained and carries just a faint hint of peach and nettle. The slender, juicy palate is all about zesty, lithe citrus and herbal spice. Very refreshing and light.
title: Zantho 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)

description: A rosé of Sangiovese from southern Tuscany (Montalcino), Lo Sbrancato features ripe aromas of wild berry, cranberry and white almond. It's a simple, fresh wine that would pair well with mussels steamed in cream sauce.
title: Il Poggione 2009 Lo Sbrancato Rosé (Toscana)

description: On the rich side, this smooth wine discloses flavors of caramel and toasted almonds as well as fruit. It leaves a sweet feeling, rounded and ripe, finished with a touch of pepper and spice.
title: Château Pigoudet 2013 Insolite Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: Waipara isn't usually considered Sauvignon Blanc country, but this is a creditable effort, boasting ample melon and fig flavors and a shot of grassiness on the otherwise soft finish.
title: Grey's Peak 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara)

description: So what does ten bucks buy in Pinot Noir? A light-bodied wine with tart, green strawberry, cola and cranberry flavors, plenty of crisp acids and smooth tannins.
title: Monthaven 2000 Pinot Noir (California)

description: When the Craig style of extreme ripeness works, it's decadently delicious. When it doesn't, the wines can be tired. This '06 Bordeaux blend hovers in the middle. It's superrich in black currants and milk chocolate, yet has a melted feeling that needs greater tannin-acid structure.
title: Robert Craig 2006 Affinity Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Fiery and borderline herbaceous aromas are green-leaning, which is surprising considering that 2011 was a warm, dry, highly regarded vintage in Rioja. On the palate, this feels strained, with outsized acidity. Herbal, roasted wild-berry flavors come with a lot of oak and clove, while the finish is fairly tart and herbal.
title: Ramón Bilbao 2011 Mirto  (Rioja)

description: A clumsy wine. While there's some good blackberry fruit, the mouthfeel is sharp and edgy, suggesting green stems and pips resulting in hard tannins. Doesn't seem likely to age out.
title: Midsummer Cellars 2007 Cañon Creek Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The bouquet on this blend of Cab, Zin, Merlot and Tempranillo is fairly smooth and complex, with spice and modest heat. The palate, however, seems to be on the roasted and burnt side of the fence, with chocolate notes bringing up the rear. This is tasty but heavy, grabby and hot.
title: Viñas de Garza 2008 Amado IV Red (Valle de Guadalupe)

description: This is a sound, everyday Merlot with some special qualities that give it an extra point or two. It's dry and smooth in tannins, with layers of cherries, blackberries, currants and licorice. Not likely to age well, so give it a little time to breathe and drink now.
title: Magistrate 2011 Limited Production Merlot (Central Coast)

description: Drying, dusty white stone characterizes the nose of this luminous sparkler, which is informal and fun and perfect as an aperitif. The wine segues into creamy peach, backed by thick, frosty foam.
title: Caposaldo NV Brut  (Prosecco del Veneto)

description: The style is usually big and bold, but for the moment this wine, though dense and dark, has a hole in the middle. Rich scents of black cherry, blueberry and earth seem to vanish, leaving only a tannic finish.  —P.G
title: Tefft Cellars 1999 Merlot (Yakima Valley)

description: A darker, denser red that offers chocolate, black fruit and spice on the nose and palate. A spin of nutty spice and dried fruit punctuates the cherry and raisin fruit. Slightly Port-like and heavier, this wine will soften with time in the bottle.
designation: Ammos Terra Leone Single Vineyard Selection
title: Palivou 2004 Ammos Terra Leone Single Vineyard Selection Agiorgitiko (Nemea)

description: This wine is herbal, prickly and roasted, singing the Salta tune of oddness and earthiness. It feels medium to full in the mouth, with a roasted dark-berry flavor and plenty of herb and pimiento tones. Finishes deep but salty, with notes of roasted red pepper and stew. A blend of 80% Malbec and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Bodega Tacuil 2010 RD Red (Calchaquí Valley)

description: Albera is a very well-valued Barbera d'Asti with chalky aromas of talc powder and schoolroom blackboard backed by cherries, blueberries and black fruit. Those polished mineral notes makes this is very interesting and unique expression of this native Italian grape.
title: Araldica 2007 Albera  (Barbera d'Asti)

description: Brisk acidity is the best thing about this sweet Sauvignon Blanc. It has jammy flavors of pineapples and oranges. Bring on the sausages and ham.
title: Pedroncelli 2010 East Side Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is chewy and tannic, with sharp edges around cranberry fruit. It's blocky and one-dimensional, but solid and substantial. If Pinot Noir can ever be a steak wine, this is it. A touch of anise and coffee winds it down through the finish.
title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2013 Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Feels rather full in the mouth, but the flavors aren't as big as its body. Dry, citrusy notes (lemon peel, lemonade) play on the palate and the finish. Nose offers lots of toast and butterscotch.
title: Balnaves of Coonawarra 1999 Chardonnay (Coonawarra)

description: Sweet and simple, like pineapple, orange and mango fruit juice from the supermarket.
title: Grandmaster 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)

description: A subdued nose of earth leads to an off-dry palate with a core of ripe, yellow plums framed by pithy citrus. It is pith rather than freshness that defines this rounded wine.
title: Antoine Moltès & Fils 2015 Tradition Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: This opens with dark aromas of leather, tobacco, cured meat, plum and prune. It shows soft tannins and loads of dark fruit on the finish.
title: Terre di Poggio 2010 Passo Cale  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: A zippy, lively version, this light-bodied wine smells and tastes like a combo of grapefruit, lemon and peach juices, having a crisp character on first sip, and a rich softness on the second.
title: Twisted 2014 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A robust structure of tannin and oak in this fuller-bodied wine masks the finer components of black cherry and blackberry fruit that lurk underneath layers of tobacco and cigar box.
title: Markham 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Shows the dry astringency, sharp acidity and bitterness of a fine, young Petite Sirah, with currant and pepper flavors accented with smoky oak. Doesn't seem likely to develop, so drink now with hearty fare, like pasta with sausages.
title: McManis 2008 Petite Sirah (California)

description: A vineyard change in 2008 moves the source of the grapes north from Red Mountain to the Royal Slope. Young vines yield rather tight, bare flavors, with sweet grain and vanilla components contributed by the oak barrel (just one barrel was produced).
title: :Nota Bene 2008 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Mourvèdre (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made in the ripe, sweet, oaky California style, this barrel-fermented Chardonnay has flavors of pineapples, pears, peaches, buttered toast and vanilla cream, balanced with crisp acidity.
title: Y Rousseau 2009 Milady Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: This extremely pale rosato doesn't have a very expressive nose, but the lively palate delivers juicy white cherry, light raspberry and flinty mineral alongside crisp acidity.
title: Girolamo Russo 2013 Rosato Nerello Mascalese (Etna)

description: From vineyards at 2000 feet elevation, this is a rich and spicy wine that has a pure streak of fruit freshness and a firmly tannic core. It is perfumed from Touriga Nacional in the blend, with red berry and black plum flavors coming through strongly along, balanced by acidity. It will be better from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Barão de Figueira Reserva Red (Beira Interior)

description: This Rhône blend is based on Syrah. It's a typically soft, lush and slightly sweet Paso Robles red wine, with easy flavors of red currants, raspberries, cherries, chocolate, beef jerky and pepper.
title: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2006 Hell's Kitchen Red (Paso Robles)

description: Made with Raboso grapes, this foamy pink sparkling wine  offers feminine tones of rose, raspberry and cranberry. Closed with a silver string, the spago argento, it is a delicately sweet and feminine wine.
title: Riondo NV Pink Spago Argento rosé Raboso (Veneto)

description: Lemon and apple lend shape to this clean and uncomplicated white that boasts a little spice on the midpalate.
title: Neumeister 2013 Gemischter Satz White (Südoststeiermark)

description: Smooth and easy-drinking, this medium-bodied wine has the attributes many people enjoy: vanilla and coconut aromas, lightly sweet apple flavors that coat the palate, and a pear syrup quality that lingers on the finish.
title: Dark Horse 2015 Chardonnay (California)

description: This unbaked wine in a can tastes a bit tired, but it has an earthy appeal. The color is a brownish red and the aromas seem dusty and mature. The flavors are beefy and peppery while the texture is nicely tannic.
title: Sans Wine Co 2016 Poor Ranch Vineyards Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

description: Toast and char sit atop the bouquet like a heavy king on his throne, but there's nothing fake or weak about it. The color is dark and the palate is round; flavors of black plum, figs and black olives convey a meaty, true personality amid all the char, chocolate and vanilla. A good wine in the massive category that is value-priced Merlot.
title: Rutini 2006 Trumpeter Merlot (Mendoza)

description: Made with a 50-50 blend of Grillo and Catarratto, this presents aromas of Spanish broom and ripe orchard fruit. The refreshing palate tastes of juicy lime, unripe pear and mineral alongside zesty acidity.
title: Zisola 2015 Azisa Grillo (Sicilia)

description: Smells bland, with a bit of apple. The palate is candied and soft, with sweet orange, mango and other tropical flavors. Finishes honeyed and lazy, with sweet, simple flavors of honeydew and apple juice.
designation: Equilibrio Made With Organically Grown Grapes
title: Aresti 2009 Equilibrio Made With Organically Grown Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Deep pink in color, this is a caramel-flavored, heavy wine. It is fat, very full and bitter at the end.
title: Château Queyssard 2014 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: A blend of Tibouren, Cinsault, Grenache and Syrah, this is exactly the kind of authoritatively flavored yet nicely balanced rosé that Provence is famous for. Peach, cherry and melon scents all mingle easily, finishing with clean, minerally accents that invite another sip.
title: Château de Pampelonne 2007 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: This rich blend of Trebbiano d'Abruzzo (70%), Passerina and Riesling offers a thick, creamy mouthfeel and plenty of melon, stone fruit and apricot. It might lack a bit of freshness and for that reason this white wine should be paired with a chicken or fish recipe that includes a zesty citrus component.
title: Illuminati Dino 2010 Costalupo White (Controguerra)

description: Spice notes take center stage and are enhanced by deep tones of blackberries, cherries, black chocolate and espresso. This Montepulciano, made by celebrated enologist Stefano Chioccioli, is a bit raw and thorny in the mouth and has sour tannins.
title: Oriel 2005 Palio  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: Sour plum and cranberry aromas are almost volatile, leading to a racy, acidic palate. Snappy, tart flavors of red plum and pie cherry finish with scouring acidity. This is a fresh but raw Malbec.
title: Emiliana 2012 Natura Malbec (Rapel Valley)

description: This wine has a lush nose—vanilla, spice—but its flavor is refreshing and crisp. Waves of spice and citrus are well balanced and elegant. A simple but food-friendly sip.
title: Billsboro 2007 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

description: This Champagne is soft and has some sweetness (although technically Brut). Ripe melon and pear fruits are cut with enough acidity to keep the wine fresh and fruity.
title: Canard-Duchêne NV Authentic Brut  (Champagne)

description: Mild citrus aromas are aided by crushed mineral notes. This rosé feels chunky as it blows up on the palate with a cloud of foam. Apricot and orange flavors finish foamy and yeasty in flavor.
title: Cave Geisse NV Cave Amadeu Rosé Brut Pinot Noir (Pinto Bandeira)

description: Chunky and a bit dull smelling, with apple, melon and peach aromas. Papaya and green melon flavors seem to be flattening with age, and the finish is long but nondescript. Drink now or wait for the '09. Imported by Alamos USA.
title: Alamos 2008 Torrontés (Salta)

description: Made from Cab Franc, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, in that order, this is a very flavorful wine, with rich blackberry, black currant, cocoa and cedar flavors. But it's very sharp in acidity, with a jalapeño pepper burn that limits its appeal.
title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2009 Chukker Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: While rich, this blend of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is also quite herbal in character. Maybe it gets its nature from the wild garrigue countryside of Provence, but its tannins are firm and the fruit is laced with licorice. It should age another year.
title: Château Margüi 2011 Titien de Margüi Red (Coteaux Varois en Provence)

description: This shows lots of Chardonnay charm and lusciousness. The texture is creamy and buttery, the flavors are suggestive of ripe pineapples and oranges, plus layers of vanilla and butterscotch are just right.
title: Aura 2011 Chardonnay (California)

description: Intensely smoky and earthy in style, this wild-ferment Riesling is strikingly dry with pressed apple and pear flavors struck with lime acidity. Lean and linear, it's bristling and tart to the finish.
title: Bellwether 2012 A&D Vineyard Wild Ferment Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Tasting mature and mellow, this deceptively full-bodied wine has sun-baked aromas, prune and dried-cherry flavors, and a smooth texture. It's lightly tart on the finish.
title: Fenestra 2012 Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

description: Blended by Jean-René Matignon, technical director of Château Pichon Baron, this is a smooth, ripe wine with balanced wood and spice flavors. They give weight to berry fruits, rich plums and fragrant acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Cap Royal 2012  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Aromas of pink grapefruit and passion fruit are more in the Sauvignon Blanc field than your typical Chardonnay. Citric and bouncy on the palate, this tastes of tart grapefruit, orange peel and salt, and it stays that way through the finish.
title: Famiglia Meschini 2015 Unoaked Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Tart and tight, this mixes chalky, citrus-inflected acids with light fruit flavors of wild berries. There's a palate-drying minerality, and the sharp acids and ultradry tannins are tough to punch through.
title: Griffin Creek 2012 Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

description: This wine comes from the original, own-rooted, 1965 plantings. It would be interesting to trace the ancestry of these vines, as such things were far less understood 50 years ago. Soft, round and fruity, this offers pleasant flavors of melon and apple. A dash of vanilla cookie coming through as it finishes.
title: David Hill 2014 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: This Merlot is as pale as a Pinot Noir, which suggests how light bodied it is. It's silky and dry in the mouth, with pleasant cherry, cola and sandalwood flavors.
title: Montoya 2010 Merlot (Monterey County)

description: This opens with aromas that recall spring flower, citrus and a whiff of honeydew melon. The rather lean, linear palate shows grapefruit and flint alongside racy acidity. A bitter almond note signals the finish.
designation: Bruno Broglia del Comune di Gavi
title: Broglia 2013 Bruno Broglia del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

description: A little forced and pickled on the nose, but overall this is pretty much your standard value-priced Chilean Cab, meaning it offers herbal notes and olive along with medium-level currant and plum flavors. Very basic and by no means a bad wine.
title: Concha y Toro 2010 Xplorador Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: The aromas of cola, java chip, licorice and cherry are pleasant and plentiful, ultimately evolving into grapey dark-fruit and cedary spice flavors. With its medium-grained tannins, modestly concentrated flavors and supporting acids, this should pair well with burgers or other casual foods.
title: Vivác Winery 2009 Petite Sirah (New Mexico)

description: Rooty and leafy on the nose, with red berry aromas peeking through some obvious oak. The palate offers cherry and raspberry flavors along with sweetness, and things are backed by vanilla and chocolate. Good, tasty and oaky, with proper layering.
title: Ventisquero 2008 Grey [Glacier] Single Block Trinidad Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)

description: Heavily charred aromas throw a shadow over roasted, stalky red-berry notes. This feels tight, choppy and drawing, with no give to the palate. Roasted, salty plum and berry flavors end with a final round of hard, pounding tannins.
title: Altocedro 2013 Año Cero Tempranillo (La Consulta)

description: A simple, fruity and caramel-flavored blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, this is soft and smooth. Just enough acidity keeps it clean and crisp.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2016 Nana Rosé (Tejo)

description: Ripe and sweet blackberry jam and dried fig flavors fill out this Port-style sweet wine. Good doses of tannin and acidity keep it structured enough to not feel cloying, lending a little textural grip.
title: Casto Oaks 2014 Syrah Port (Sierra Foothills)

description: Citrus, red plum and currant aromas are wild and gamy. This has an edgy mouthfeel with a rubbery sensation, while citrus and candied red-berry flavors hum along.
title: Santa Carolina 2014 Reserva Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Relatively broad on the palate and lush in texture, this Riesling's ripe melon and pear flavors are partially balanced by hints of citrus pith. Yet it remains sweet overall, and probably should be paired with spicy dishes or cheese to show at its best.
title: Grey's Peak 2009 Riesling (Waipara)

description: This is a light and open wine, showing more fruitiness characteristic spice of Pinot Gris. It does have almond and green herb flavors, along with a touch of pepper and bitterness. Drink now.
title: Frédéric Mallo 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: A pretty floral nose and appetizing, juicy flavors of jammy fruit should recommend this wine, but there's a bitterness on the midplate and finish that make the wine a touch too angular. Pair with food to even it out.
title: Casa Rondeña Winery 2005 Calvin Clarion Red (New Mexico)

description: A little harsh in the mouth, with minty, peppery flavors and tart acids, but you'll find enough cherry and cola flavor to satisfy, and the structure is silky and light.
title: C&T; 2006 Patio Pinot Noir (Napa-Sonoma)

description: Made with organic grapes, this charming young red has a delightful fragrance of blue flowers and woodland berries. The zesty palate doles out crunchy red berry and a hint of white pepper accompanied by lively acidity.
title: Salcheto 2013  Chianti

description: One of the labels from the Bonnet vineyard of André Lurton, this red follows the approachable, fruity style of these wines. Red berry fruits and soft tannins make it already drinkable.
title: Château Tour de Bonnet 2010  Bordeaux

description: A blend of 52% Cabernet Sauvignon, 39% Merlot and 3% each of Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot, this wine tastes of charred wood and generic red juice, accented by a slight green character. Puckering tannins and a diluted finish complete the picture.
title: Marilyn 2012 Meritage (Napa Valley)

description: A bright, fresh example of Pinot Noir, this is medium bodied and slightly creamy in texture as well. Bold notes of red cherries and beet greens add hints of button mushroom on the palate, then finish tart and refreshing. Drink now–2016.
title: Lake Chalice 2012 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This easygoing sparkler offers subdued aromas suggesting white flower and a whiff of white stone fruit. The simple lively palate offers yellow apple and a slightly candied citrusy note alongside firm acidity and vivacious steely bubbles.
title: Tenuta Polvaro NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

description: Some good currant, cherry, cola and licorice flavors in this dry, balanced wine. It's one of the better Merlots out there at this affordable price.
title: Tre 2007 Merlot (California)

description: Riserva La Volta exhibits smoky tones of charcoal, black slate, licorice and dried black currant backed by toasted peanut or roasted chestnut. The toasted element, which seems to have become more prominent with time, is a bit overwhelming and definitely the wine's defining characteristic.
title: Viberti 2001 Riserva La Volta  (Barolo)

description: Cranberry sauce flavors and refreshing acidity make this a very delicious wine to be consumed young. Unhindered by oak or undue extraction, this shows its charming, primary fruit in an open, uncomplicated way. This is a winner with charcuterie and salami.
title: Sepp Moser 2011 Hedwighof Zweigelt (Neusiedlersee)

description: Briny grassy aromas are barely ripe and smell of match stick. This feels citric and more or less normal for a coastal SB. Pithy flavors of grapefruit skins blend with passion fruit in front of a juicy finish that tastes of white grapefruit and green herbs.
title: Errazuriz 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Dry and rough in texture, with berry, cherry, tobacco, herb and spice flavors wrapped into edgy, slightly green tannins. Turns sharp on the finish, and not likely to age.
title: Williamson Wines 2006 Clarissa Vin Rouge Red (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This perky wine offers tropical fruit, citrus and apple sensations alongside the grape's hallmark of bright acidity. It closes on a delicate note of steely mineral. Simple, but well constructed.
title: Santa Barbara 2012 Passerina (Marche)

description: Fruity in flavor and nicely rounded in texture, this medium-bodied wine from Napa-based Mason Cellars incorporates grapes from around the state. It has a good balance between lively acidity and rather ripe apple and melon flavors.
title: Three Pears 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: This is an austere wine that's tough on the palate and with high acidity. The black currant fruitiness is still developing, so the wine shouldn't be drunk before 2016.
title: Château Recougne 2011  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Simple and sweet in Chardonnay character, with pineapple, pear, peach, apple and vanilla flavors wrapped in a creamy texture.
title: Estancia 2007 Pinnacles Ranches Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Juicy, juvenile aromas of plum and berry lead to a palate that's bouncy in feel. Jammy blackberry and plum define the flavor profile, while the finish is honest, lively and fresh. Junior is the perfect name for this fruit-forward, young Rioja.
title: Paco Garcia 2011 Junior  (Rioja)

description: Sweaty citrus aromas are neither focused nor friendly. This feels flat and greasy, while it tastes like chicken fat and bitter citrus fruits. Nothing on the finish brings it around.
title: Val de Los Frailes 2014 Rosado (Cigales)

description: Here's a strange bouquet with elements that recall dried wax, pressed wild flowers and blueberry. It's a pure expression of Merlot from organically grown grapes with an easy, no-fuss mouthfeel and a touch of piquant spice on the close.
title: Pizzolato 2007 Merlot (Piave)

description: Prune and raisin aromas pour off the bouquet, providing more than a clue that this wine is on the overripe side. That's confirmed in the mouth, where things feel tannic and over the top; flavors of raisin, sugar beet and chocolate finish with heat and hardness.
title: Garnacha de Fuego 2011 Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Deep black cassis fruit, cedar and cigarbox aromas are followed by flavors of thick kirsch, anise and raspberry. Very fruity and lush, this red has an opulent character and would be tasty over ice cream.
title: Domaine Sigalas NV Apiliotis Mandilaria (Greece)

description: This is half Merlot, with Pinot Noir, Cab Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon divvying up the other half—a completely different Ranch Red than in 2013. It's sweaty and short, with some off flavors in the finish.
title: Plaisance Ranch 2014 Ranch Red (Applegate Valley)

description: Light and fruity with cherry, plum and red currant flavors along with a subtle hint of menthol on the nose. The mouthfeel is smooth and supple. Mevushal.
title: Fortant 2005 Kosher Merlot (Vin de Pays d'Oc)

description: This pink wine, originally started by figure skater Peggy Fleming as a benefit for breast cancer research, shows peach, nectarine, strawberry flesh and cotton candy aromas. There is a touch of sweetness to the sip, with baked orange and lemon curd flavors.
title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Victories Rosé of Malbec (Paso Robles)

description: A flowery Chardonnay with delicate, almost evanescent flavors of buttercup, buttered toast and grapefruit. It seems overly strong in oak and weak in fruit, showing a minerally spine and raw alcohol. Clean and bone dry, but lacks richness and vibrancy.
title: Sand Hill 2007 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: There's a slightly funky edge to this Carignan-Syrah blend, with gamy and herbal streaks to the bright red-berry aromas. The palate is a bit richer, with darker flavors of cherry and blackberry leaf that carry through to the medium-length finish.
title: Val Auclair 2010 Les Barras Red (Vallée du Paradis)

description: Cantina Tre Serre is a well-priced and informal Barbera with a thin and informal style backed by fruity freshness. There's even a tiny touch of effervescence that adds a perky and peppery sensation to the mouthfeel.
title: Vinchio-Vaglio Serra 2008 Cantina Tre Serre Barbera (Piedmont)

description: Dusty stone-fruit aromas suggest yeast and nectarine. This varietal Xarel-lo feels citrusy and spunky; flavors of melon, orange and nectarine are good but standard on the finish. Overall, this is linear and fairly basic for white wine.
title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2015 XIC Xarel-lo (Penedès)

description: This playful blend of air-dried white grapes (Prosecco and Incrocio Manzoni) offers simple aromas of honey and peach backed by some dried hay and citrus. Made with organically-grown grapes, this dessert wine is sweet and thick on the close.
title: Pizzolato NV Alba Chiara Passito 500ml White (Veneto)

description: Yeasty wine, with mature toast flavors, showing bitter almonds and old acidity. The wine tastes really mature, about to be too old.
title: Raposeira 2002 Super Reserve Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante de Qualidade)

description: Hits the fat and the lean of Sauvignon Blanc with both fig and grassy flavors. A well-balanced wine, it shows a smooth mouthfeel and a long finish. This is one to have with grilled fish.
title: Saxenburg Estate 1999 Private Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Clove and beef jerky aromas are odd and forceful. A globular palate lacks form and balance, while this tastes oddly and singularly of clove.
title: Coto de Hayas 2014 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Campo de Borja)

description: Lightly oaked Chardonnay, full of yellow fruits, spice and a floral character that gives the wine a lift. Softly textured, juicy with tighter final acidity. Screwcap.
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2012 Chardonnay (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This is overtaken with unripe flavors of tomato and underbrush. There's little suggestion of fresh fruit. Aged 14 months in one-use French oak, it finishes quickly with earthy tannins.
title: Valley View 2013 Anna Maria Tempranillo (Rogue Valley)

description: Earthy, muddled berry aromas are suggestive of prune and raisin. This is full and rugged on the palate, with leathery, baked plum and berry flavors that finish with a strong wood-based character and modest residual fruit notes.
title: Sierra Norte 2012 Temperamento Bobal (Utiel-Requena)

description: Pretty rustic, with sharp acidity giving a bite to honey-sweet pineapple, green apple and lime flavors. The blend is based on Chardonnay.
title: Rhapsody 2010 White (Napa County)

description: This off-dry version of Orvieto offers fragrances of ripe pear and stone fruit. On the easygoing palate, hints of bitter almond accent yellow peach and green apple. It's simple but well made.
title: Barbi 2014 Abboccato  (Orvieto Classico)

description: Aromas include dry apricot and papaya with a hint of cider. This is on the soft side in feel, with dilution along with apple-based acidity. Flavors of nectarine and peach finish monotone. Drink immediately or wait for a fresher 2012 version.
title: Ferrum 2011 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Creamy with ripe apricot and peach fuzz flavors, this Sauvignon Blanc has a wet stone quality to it as well, with an oak presence and lightly sweet finish.
title: Page Mill Winery 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)

description: This is the kind of wine that will be wildly popular as a cocktail sipper. It has the fruit, spice and oaky vanilla to appeal to almost all palates, yet is dry and crisp in acidity, leaving behind a clean, fruity finish.
title: Valley of the Moon 2006 Pinot Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Light and bright with plenty of fruit and a lsoft texture, this lemon-flavored wine has crisp acidity and a ready-to-drink freshness. Drink now.
title: Patient Cottat 2014 Le Grand Caillou Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)

description: Briary berry and cedar flavors are marred by less ripe notes of green herbs. It's dry, tannic and spicy.
title: Cinnabar 2010 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Brambly blackberry and leathery tar make for a full-bodied atmosphere around what is actually a fairly light, integrated and smooth wine. Clove and black currant give the finish a spicy edge.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2013 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Hot earth, baked cherry and mild vanilla aromas come in front of a snappy, angular palate with tangy pie-cherry and red-plum flavors. Sheer and basic Rioja with high acidity, lean fruit, a cleansing finish and a light body.
title: Montecillo 2007 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: Earthy, dry and leathery on the nose, with slightly briny red-fruit aromas, this meets all the requirements of very good everyday Pinot Noir. Tea, brandied black cherry, spice and oak flavors darken up and turn chocolaty on the finish.
title: Sierra Batuco 2012 Reserva Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Aggressive on the palate, this has harp acids that frame flavors of sour cherry candy and green mint.
title: Grove Ridge 2011 Merlot (California)

description: A weird wine with a distinct and overriding clove character that's manifested on the nose, palate and finish. One-dimensional and strange, with way too much clove impact.
title: Argana 2010 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: This contains all five red Bordeaux varieties, aged individually before blending and barrel aging. Merlot is the majority, and it shows in the wine's coaxing of soft plumminess and simple seasoning of cinnamon and allspice.
title: Viszlay Vineyards 2013 Five Vines Estate Red (Russian River Valley)

description: This is still the current release. A very hot vintage in Washington, it leads with a Portlike nose of raisins and prunes; follows with soft, ripe and roasted flavors. The tannins are deep and earthy. Drink now. —P.G.
title: Kiona 1998 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Subdued aromas of hay, tropical fruit and yellow bell pepper lead the nose. It's rather lean, with grapefruit, candied nectarine peel and hints of a confectionary note alongside bracing acidity.
title: Loacker 2014 Tasmin Sauvignon (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

description: Bonheur—happiness—is an appropriate name for this fresh and crisp wine that comes in a flute à corset bottle. It is fruity, lively with orange and apricot over raspberries. Bright acidity finishes it all in good humor.
title: Thomas Carteron 2014 Le Bonheur Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Orange peel aromas are a bit stony. In the mouth, this feels like it's past its prime, with little to no intensity or acidity. Mild apple flavors are sweet, mealy and honeyed, while the ending is leesy and mushy.
title: Castro Martin 2013 Family Estate Selection Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Starts with creamy, oak-based aromas of milk chocolate and mocha, yet the fruit notes below are kind of short and briary. Flavors of strawberry also come with sharper hints of rhubarb, while the finish is medium in length, balanced and tastes of chocolate. Not a bad effort for Chile. 2,500 cases made.
title: Viña Tabalí 2007 Reserva Especial Pinot Noir (Limarí Valley)

description: A ruby-colored sparkling dessert wine from northern Italy, Brachetto d'Acqui enjoys a long history rooted in Italian tradition, and it can be paired with sweet foods and savory ones alike. This is soft and round with notes of raspberry and candied cherry on the close.
title: La Gironda di Galandrino 2011  Brachetto d'Acqui

description: This is a syrupy, ripe take on Grenache, which renders it varietally unrecognizable. There's a deep core of cassis and black cherry fruit, but any remaining details have been blown out by the alcohol.
title: Simple Machine 2012 Grenache (Rogue Valley)

description: Aromas of mature black plum and baking spices take center stage on this young red. The ripe palate offers graphite, licorice and red cherry but it's a bit limited on freshness so enjoy it soon with savory first courses like pasta topped with ragù.
title: Terre Nere di Campigli - Vallone 2012  Rosso di Montalcino

description: This delicious, fruity, lightly sweet wine blends ripe berries and black cherries on a smooth, supple texture. A touch of lip-smacking tannin balances it out.
title: HandCraft 2015 Artisan Collection Dark Red (California)

description: Aroma of freshly cut red apple, raspberry and cherry are followed by sweet jammy red and black-fruit flavors. It goes down easily.
title: Ryan Patrick 2015 Redhead Red Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This luminous blend of Insolia and Viognier offers a very pretty and feminine juxtaposition of fragrant floral aromas (from the Viognier) against tones of citrus, peach and kiwi from the Insolia. There's a touch of sweetness on the close.
title: Baglio di Pianetto 2010 Ficiligno White (Sicilia)

description: An aggressive, forward, high-acid wine with a lot of quality as well. The nose mixes dried cheese, leather, heat and savory red fruit aromas, while the palate rides a tight line of acidity toward angular raspberry and cherry flavors. Very zesty, tart and lively, but also deep in terms of minerality, freshness and potency. Drink now through 2012.
title: Morandé 2007 Edición Limitada Carignan (Loncomilla Valley)

description: Aromas of spice, macerated cherry, vanilla and blackberry lead to jammy, sweet-seeming fruit flavors. It provides easy-drinking appeal, with grainy tannins backing it all up.
title: Canoe Ridge 2014 Limited Edition The Benches Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: With slightly subdued aromas of spiced apples and lemon, this Gewürztraminer introduces itself a bit unusually. The round, full-bodied palate reveals more characteristic lychee and floral tones offset by soft lemony acidity. It concludes with a hint of alcoholic warmth.
title: Red Newt Cellars 2012 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine has intense aromas of blueberry pie and vanilla, along with a barnyard note. The palate is jammy in prune and baked berry flavors. There is a yeasty and resinous quality as well. The finish is long, tart and mouthwatering, with a charred-oak note on the back.
title: Narmada 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

description: Dolcetto Vigna Costa Fiore opens with a dense, modern appearance and big aromas of ripe fruit and mature blackberry. There's also a touch of Band Aid or wet animal at the back that is barely perceptible now, but that may worsen with time. The wine is chewy and bright on the close.
title: Cascina Adelaide 2008 Vigna Costa Fiore  (Dolcetto di Diano d'Alba)

description: With its green, herbal aromas, this wine could come from New Zealand. It's crisp with intense gooseberry and packed with citrus and green apple flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Bonnet 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: One of the first bottles from this newly approved appellation, this wine brings aromas of raspberry, herb, tire rubber and barrel spice. The palate is elegant and smooth with assorted red-fruit flavors.
title: Colter's Creek 2013 Colter's Creek Vineyard Cabernet Franc

description: This has a powerful, briary character, with a spicy, high-alcohol kick. It erupts in the mouth, with flavors of wild berry, tobacco, cola, anise and white pepper that should pair well with equally spicy fare, preferably fatty meats and cheeses.
title: Pech Merle 2010 Treborce Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Buttercream aromas show shyly on the nose of this bottling, coating the pear flesh and fresh lime scents. It's somewhat flat on the palate, with ripe Pink Lady apple and melon flavors.
title: Hahn 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: The vineyard is on Howell Mountain. It's an awkward wine, with lots to like, but some problems. On the plus side is enormous  cassis, cherry and chocolate fruit flavor and rich, fine tannins, and the 100% new oak seems proper given the wine's volume. But there's too much sugary sweetness in the finish, almost like a dessert wine.
title: Beringer 2004 Bancroft Ranch Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: A nice everyday sparkler. It's a little sweet and very forward in lime and strawberry flavors, with the yeast and toast complications of a fine sparkling wine.
title: Gloria Ferrer NV VA de VI Ultra Cuvée Sparkling (Sonoma County)

description: Here's an inky black and densely concentrated Cabernet Sauvignon that would pair with grilled sausage or barbecued steak. The wine is soft, round and slightly sweet on the finish.
title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2008 Missoni Cabernet Sauvignon (Sicilia)

description: This is a direct but tasty and well-balanced Pinot, with vibrant aromas and flavors of juicy cherry, blueberry and wild strawberry, all graced by hints of purple flowers and sweet spice. The mouthfeel is soft yet structured, with delicate tannins and a slight lushness that lingers on the finish.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: A light-bodied, delicate style of Pinot Noir, with pretty cherry fruit and plenty of forest and earth complexity. Silky on the finish, with hints of tea leaf. Probably best over the next year or two.
title: Ara 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: An elegant nose of deep spice and fruit leads on this Meritage from the Snake River Valley of Idaho—an emerging region to watch for interesting reds. The wine offers sturdy red fruit, spice and structure, and seems made for hearty fare like grilled steaks or, if you feel like splurging, a kobe burger.
title: Koenig Vineyards 2004 Cuvée Alden Private Reserve Red Meritage

description: The thin, tart palate displays cranberry-plum fruit and the nose is of newsprint, driftwood and currants. This sensory combo is not as odd as it sounds, but the wine could use more depth.
title: Sinnya 2001 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Robertson)

description: A 100% Viognier that's heady in ripe pit fruit, mostly sweet peach, and accented in nutty, floral aromas. It's full-bodied and  robust, with tannins that are soft and juicy.
title: Novy 2013 Sunny View Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)

description: Slightly leafy and milky, but with tobacco, licorice and pepper notes accenting primary aromas of red fruit. The palate is medium in weight and intensity, while flavors of rhubarb and cherry settle on herbal plum.
title: Santa Carolina 2007 Reserva Carmenère (Rapel Valley)

description: Despite some well-ripened red and black currant, licorice and cola flavors, this dry Zin has a bitterness in the finish that gives it a bit of a rustic feel. Drink now.
title: Tin Barn 2005 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: This soft wine has red fruits attractively embedded in the bright texture. The relatively high dosage results in its fruity character. Simple in texture, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Chassenay d'Arce NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)

description: Vibrant pink in color, this rosé of Chambourcin, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot is light bodied and easy to drink, driven by tart watermelon.
title: Rappahannock Cellars 2014 Rosé (Virginia)

description: Founded in 1915, Donelli produces some of central Italy's finest Lambrusco bottlings. This dry, red sparkler has enough acidity and fizzy effervescence to cut through local cuisine, such as tortellini with cheese or butter. The bouquet shows red berry, strawberry and blackberry. Made with 90% Lambrusco di Sorbara grapes.
title: Donelli NV Scaglietti  (Lambrusco di Sorbara)

description: Bright and clean, this drinks easily thanks to its fresh aromas of citrus and stone fruit. The compact, crisp mouthfeel finishes with a touch of grated lemon zest.
title: Ruffino 2011 Lumina Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

description: This Pinot Gris has aromas of wax, red apple, underripe white peach and citrus. The white peach note becomes more dominant on the easygoing palate, and it leads to a mineral-like tang that lingers onto the slightly yeasty finish.
title: Pollak 2012 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Monticello)

description: A blend of just over one-third Riesling, Atwater's Riewürz boasts a steely precision that cuts through all of Gewürztraminer's ebullient floral and juicy fruit characteristics. Semidry on the palate, with deliciously concentrated pomelo flavors, it finishes on a zesty, candied orange-peel note.
title: Atwater 2009 Riewürz White (Finger Lakes)

description: Pretty violet aromas elevate this off-dry wine, accenting sunny flavors of quince and tangerine on the palate. Brisk lime acidity lends a brash, nervy feel that extends through the finish. A touch of savory herb lingers.
title: Louis Guntrum 2012 Riesling (Germany)

description: Milk chocolate, plastic and wet dog aromas improve with airing. It's abrasive and scratchy on the palate, with blackberry and milk chocolate flavors that lead to a finish with one last dosage of milk chocolaty sweetness. This contains 15% Garnacha.
title: Familia Solana 2009  Toro

description: A drop in alcohol by more than a full percent since the excellent 2009 Nysa was released suggests that this vintage did not achieve optimal ripeness. Bitter upon entry, with a medicinal note, this remains stiff and unyielding, with tart cranberry fruit and sharp acids.
title: Torii Mor 2010 Nysa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: La Casa dell'Orco offers an interesting interpretation of Fiano that is slightly bigger and fatter than most. This golden wine opens with aromas of mature fruit, melon, apricot and a spicy touch of freshly cut grass at the very end. It moves smoothly over the mouth and shows medium intensity.
title: La Casa Dell'Orco 2009  Fiano di Avellino

description: There's little going on aromatically or texturally in this thin, fairly nondescript wine.
title: Zinsane 2011 Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Aromas of orange zest, apple cider and yeast come in front of a plump, slightly wayward palate with citric acidity. Generic citrus flavors finish lemony but with acidic scour.
title: Esperanza 2015 Verdejo-Viura (Rueda)

description: This has lots of tropical and apricot flavors, with oak and creamy lees notes. It's simple and a bit sweet, but should appeal to consumers.
title: Joullian 2009 Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Barbera d'Alba delivers a fresh, slightly raw note of raspberry or wild berry surrounded by light shadings of spice and smoke. This is a balanced wine with bright fruit tones and fresh acidity that showcases a clean, traditional style.
title: Rizzi 2008  Barbera d'Alba

description: Just off dry, this is a smooth, attractively fruity wine that has a light touch of perfume. The acidity keeps the freshness level up, producing a wine that's easy to drink now. Screwcap.
title: Wolfberger 2011 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)

description: This ruby-colored Chianti Classico (with 5% other grapes added to a Sangiovese base) has a broad personality with deep tones of ripe cherry, spice and smoked meat or beef jerky in the background. It imparts flavors of sweet cherry, roasted nut and distant mineral tones.
title: Castelli del Grevepesa 2006 Lessenziale  (Chianti Classico)

description: A big, rich wine, from a fine year in the Loire. The fruits are sweet, although the acidity and texture make this wine dry. Flavors of peach, pear and spice work well together here, giving a fine, ripe mouthful of creamy mousse.
title: Gratien et Meyer 2005 Premium Millésimé Brut  (Saumur)

description: A roughly equal blend of Tempranillo and Grenache, this appealing wine showcases pretty pomegranate and raspberry fruit. In the mouth the flavors turn a little candied, with a gumdrop character that thickens the finish.
title: Jaxon 2012 Tradición Tempranillo-Garnacha (Rogue Valley)

description: Ripe in tropical fruit, apricot and Meyer lemon flavors, it shows plenty of toasty oak. It's dry and creamy but not particularly complex. Drink up.
title: Bernardus 2012 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A likable, easy to drink wine, totally dry and brisk in acidity, with low alcohol. It has savory flavors of lemons, limes, oranges and spices.
title: Holman Ranch 2010 Pinot Gris (Carmel Valley)

description: Dark berry fruit, a touch of cocoa and a dusty quality show on the nose of this twist-top bottling. There is lots of tannic structure on the sip, with mouthfuls of black and purple fruit, some black pepper and a touch of bitter coffee.
title: Clos LaChance 2012 Syrah (Central Coast)

description: Perfumed aromas of flowers, peach and hard candy lead to dry stone-fruit flavors. Its variety is unmistakable.
title: TruthTeller 2015 Frolic Viognier (Yakima Valley)

description: A blend of 83% Syrah with 17% Petite Sirah, this is a juicy wine, bursting in black plum, blackberry and gamy smoke. Low in oak imprint, it's medium bodied, approachable and easy to like, plenty tannic but not over the top.
title: Preston 2012 Syrah-Sirah Syrah-Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This very rich, unctuous Syrah is immature and not especially subtle at this time. It's acidic and gooey in jammy blackberries and cherries and milk chocolate, with obvious oak influences. The idea seems to be ageworthiness, but that's a gamble. Could surprise.
title: Vice Versa 2005 Ulises Valdez Vineyard Syrah (Napa Valley)

description: The nose on this wine mixes up apricots, peaches and lime granita with a charred dill element. The palate shows almonds, Meyer lemon and freshly-cut nectarine, altogether refreshing if not wildly memorable.
title: Martin Ranch 2013 J.D. Hurley Griva Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Part of the Thienot Champagne group, Canard-Dûchene is only now getting distribution in this country. This top Blanc de Blancs is rich, full-bodied with some softness, but also retaining a good mineral, tight texture.
designation: Charles VII Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Canard-Duchêne NV Charles VII Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: Not considered a noble varietal, Carignane can offer pleasure, and this one does. ItÕs quite rich and smells and tastes Porty, with dark chocolate and raisin notes, although the official alcohol is a moderate 13.6%. The plummy flavors are powerful, the tannins and acids soft.
title: Preston 1999 Carignane (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Clove, cardamom and cumin appear as pretty accents over a thick base of fruity cassis and blackberry. There are aromas of cigar and roasted chestnut in there as well and the wine offers dried herbs and chopped mint on the finish.
title: Calatrasi 2005 D'istinto Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: This seems as if it was assembled from lesser barrels. It's pleasant, very light, simple and tart; the dominant flavor is cranberry juice.
title: Amity 2006 Estate Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Soft, bitter and overripe, with raisin, mocha and Port flavors. It's a Rhône-style blend.
title: San Antonio 2009 Heritage Red (Paso Robles)

description: This offers notes of white strawberry, cherry and melon rind on the nose and mouth. Medium-minus in weight, flavors of lime peel and tart cherry skin lend astringent grip to the close.
title: Fortant 2016 Coast Select Grenache Rosé (Pays d'Oc)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Sangiovese, this pleasant red has aromas of dark-skinned fruit, toast and a whiff of espresso. The light-bodied, straightforward palate offers cherry, red currant and a hint of light spice alongside zesty acidity and polished tannins.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2014 Castiglioni Red (Toscana)

description: Mossy, furry, leafy black fruit aromas are a reasonably good opening. Feels upright and alert, with bright acidity. Flavors of plum and berry blend with chocolate, herbs and spice in front of a grabby, slightly clacky finish.
title: Siegel 2010 Crucero Reserva Merlot (Colchagua Valley)

description: Mature orchard fruit and toasted nut aromas lead the nose of this wine while the ripe, medium-bodied palate delivers exotic fruit, yellow pear and candied lemon drop flavors. It closes on a confected note.
title: Montonale 2015 Orestilla  (Lugana)

description: A blend of all five Bordeaux varieties, this wine is dry and a bit rustic. It shows pepper and thyme-infused flavors of blackberries and currants, finished with some astringent tannins. Drink soon.
title: Beringer 2006 Alluvium Red (Knights Valley)

description: Spicy and earthy, this medium-bodied red is rewarding in its layers of dried herb, sage and strawberry patch. The tartness lingers on the lean palate, ending in cranberry and cardamom.
title: Spicy Vines 2015 Peter's Delight Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Glimmers of minerality lend elegance to zesty white grapefruit, lemon and pear notes in this dry, full-bodied Pinot Gris. A brisk backbone of acidity balances nicely against a mouthfeel that's succulent and satisfying. Drink now through 2016.
title: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2014 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

description: Whiffs of sweet curry spice and fennel are enticing on the nose of this earthy, rather savory Riesling from Rock Stream. Lean in profile and vibrantly acidic with a squeaky, lemony sheen, it's the perfect pairing for subtly spiced South Indian cuisine.
title: Rock Stream 2009 Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Soft white peach and citrus aromas are touched by a wave of vanilla in this pretty white. On the palate, it offers full-bodied fruit and spice flavors but never loses its balance and finesse. A friendly and easy-going wine with enough body to pair against richer dishes.
title: Domaine Sigalas 2014 Fermented in Oak Barrel Assyrtiko (Santorini)

description: The floral aromas seem somewhat wilted, with peach notes lurking in the background. It's full in feel, drinking dry.
title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2014 Vivacious Viognier 76%/Roussanne 24% White

description: Made entirely with native grape Nascetta, this opens with aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of hay. The straightforward, rather lean palate offers tropical fruit, lemon zest and a hint of toasted hazelnut alongside refreshing acidity.
title: Serra dei Fiori 2015 La Regina Nascetta (Langhe)

description: Fresh, bright wine that feels light in texture and weight. That makes it suited for shellfish rather than more intense dishes. Attractive, ready to drink.
title: Manuel Olivier 2008  Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: A bit funky, the nose shows notes that suggest animal, farmyard and leather along with aromas of overripe black berries. The fruit has already dried up on the palate however, leaving green coffee bean sensations and astringent tannins that generate a drying, bitter finish. The second bottle was exactly the same.
title: Valdicava 2009  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Fresh and creamy, this is a smooth, rich wine. It has citrus and baked apple flavors that meld easily and fully into a fruity texture. With some weight, it also has a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Audaz Branco White (Alentejano)

description: This Bobal's dark, earthy berry and leather aromas are closed but presentable. On the palate, herbal plum, tomato and lightly baked berry flavors finish with the scrub of rustic tannins.
title: Chozas Carrascal 2015 Las 2ces Bobal (Utiel-Requena)

description: Albariño is not known for its aging potential, and this fairly stale offering from 2010 is proof that the textbook is correct. Aromas of white fruits, corn and hay set up a chunky palate with flavors of melon and mango that are yeasty and slightly oxidized.
title: Paco & Lola 2010 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Just 75% Cabernet, the rest a mix of Merlot, Syrah and Petit Verdot, this turns generic, with bitter berry flavors. There's a little toastiness backing the tannins but a short finish, overall.
title: Mercer 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Herbal and appley aromas lead to soft apple and melon flavors in this lively wine. With another sip, a creamy texture and richness come out that add an extra dimension of interest to this inexpensive wine that's hardly a flop.
title: flipflop 2012 Chardonnay (California)

description: This wine has potent berry, funky earth and herb aromas. Its fruity-floral flavors are tinged with a balsamic nip and a tart, rather tannic mouthfeel. To taste a little pioneering in terms of wine style, don't be alarmed at the sediment in the bottle.
title: La Clarine Farm 2014 Jambalaia Rouge Red (Sierra Foothills)

description: This wine has flavors of wild blackberry, blueberry and mocha, with a rich vein of herb, tobacco and spice. However, it's hot in alcohol, and finishes with glyceriney sweetness—almost like a minor Port. Drink up.
title: Kuleto Estate 2009 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: Raspberries cooked in butter with a clove spice appear on the nose of this wine from Monterey County. It's rich with sage-tinged blackberry juice flavors on the palate, also showing a plum-skin tartness and pencil shavings.
title: Lockwood 2013 Pinot Noir (San Lucas)

description: Briny, dusty, bready aromas set up a lively but foamy palate. Soda cracker, briny citrus and dried apricot flavors finish salty, pickled and dry, with hints of leftover citrus and green herbs.
title: Parés Baltà NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: Hearty and rustic, this opens with a nose of crushed blue flower, ripe blackberry, mature plum, allspice and a whiff of barnyard. The aromas carry over to the palate along with ripe, chewy tannins.
title: Mocavero 2013 Sjre Primitivo (Salento)

description: Smells like generic red fruits with a pinch of green herbs. Feels choppy and astringent, with green-leaning flavors of plum and raspberry. Zesty on the finish but tastes herbal and underdeveloped.
title: Chilcas 2010 Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Maule Valley)

description: Figs and spice perfume this tawny Cabernet Franc ice wine. It's a bit rustic in style, evoking layers of fallen leaves and potpourri melding with dusty raisins and figs. But it's elegantly crisp and the exotic, uniquely spicy character is seductive.
title: Glenora 2014 Ice Wine Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: A vanilla bean element leads the nose on this wine, with cherry, olallieberry and caramel syrup coming in as well. The palate isn't quite so delicious, with the vanilla flavors remaining alongside woody elements, purple fruits and black olives.
title: Clavo Cellars 2010 Dreamer Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: There's an earthy note of white mushroom or cured meat that is followed by bright freshness in the mouth. Pair this easy Barbera with cheesy pasta or pizza.
title: Cascina La Ghersa 2007 Camparó  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)

description: Bold and rich, this wine has plenty of tannins to allow it to age, and equally generous ripe black-plum fruits to make it attractive now. Solid and firm, the wine is already drinkable with its juicy fruitiness, or age until 2020.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2015 Monte da Peceguina Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Grapefruit aromas, extroverted fruit flavors and a fresh, crisp mouthfeel make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy.
title: Five Rows 2015 Marmont Vineyards Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Easygoing apple, pear and citrus aromas precede a mild palate that's a touch dilute. Melon, papaya and tropical flavors finish with a sense of lightness. This is 70% Treixadura with Torrontés and other white grapes.
title: Viña Costeira 2013 White (Ribeiro)

description: Dark as night, this is a sumptuous, rich, concentrated and full-bodied Cabernet tasting of dark berry and oak, with a trace of leather saddle on the finish.
title: Mettler Family Vineyards 2010 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Named after a traditional Portuguese dance, this open wine is full of generous fruits and soft tannins. It has structure inevitable in a Douro wine, but its light touch makes the wine remarkably food friendly. Screwcap.
title: Aveleda 2011 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: This 50-50 blend of Montepulciano and Sangiovese has blackberry, blue flower and spice aromas that carry on to the palate, along with black cherry and astringent tannins. Showing the heat of the vintage, it's also shy on freshness, so drink soon.
title: Muròla 2012  Rosso Piceno

description: The Charmat process, rather than the Champagne method, is used here. It's a clean, light, generic sparkling wine, done as a brut. Use it as an all-purpose mixer for best effect.
title: North 42 Degrees 2016 Sparkling Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Erie North Shore)

description: Plum, dark cooking spice and menthol aromas emerge in the glass. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, toast, licorice and espresso alongside assertive, grainy tannins that leave a rather raspy finish.
title: Casaloste 2011  Chianti Classico

description: This Crianza has leathery aromas, a tannic mouthfeel and roasted, spicy red berry flavors. It's dry, oaky and not particularly ripe.
title: Quasar 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)

description: This wine has an herbal aroma that leads on to the palate. It goes with the almost jammy raspberry flavor, making for a wine that is fruity while not yet balanced.
title: Château Saint Baillon 2015 Réserve du Château Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: A blend of Sangiovese and 20% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of baked plum, dark berry, mocha and vanilla. The palate offers dried black cherry, sweet baking spice and a confectionary note alongside smooth but rather fleeting tannins.
title: Sensi 2012 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

description: This négociant based in the Northern Rhône has turned out a meaty, savory Châteauneuf-du-Pape. It's full bodied and firmly structured, with plenty of clove, leather and peppered beef. Drink 2014–2020.
title: Les Vins de Vienne 2009 Les Otéliées Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Despite its name, this is in fact a rosé, which is light orange-pink in color. It is bone dry, mineral, taut and crisp. Red currant and lime flavors mingle with a tight acidity and totally dry aftertaste. Disgorged June 2012.
title: René Geoffroy NV Blanc de Rosé Extra Brut  (Champagne)

description: Made with 90% Nero d'Avola and 10% Nocera, this opens with earthy aromas of black plum, Mediterranean herb and a whiff of game. The straightforward palate displays black plum and carob alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Cantine Russo 2013 di Milazzo Red (Mamertino)

description: This is a nice, drinkable red from Red Mountain, though it does not have any varietal focus. There's light red fruit, some sense of minerality, and balancing acidity.
title: Michael Florentino 2010 Monastrell AKA Mourvèdre Monastrell (Red Mountain)

description: This looks, smells and tastes so young that it might have come right out of the fermenting tank. It is tight to the point of reductive, with tart fruit flavors of cranberry and rhubarb, and stiff, chalky tannins.
title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2013 Jordan Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Light and dainty aromas of sliced blood orange, Anjou-pear skins, dried apples and pears, and a slate-driven minerality show on the nose of this wine. It's also light on the palate, but there is a decent amount of grip and acidic texture. It's somewhat simple yet easy to quaff.
title: DeTierra Vineyards 2014 Riesling (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This Merlot, blended with a little Cabernet Sauvignon, is oaky and fairly hot with high alcohol. But it's delicious with flavors of blackberry and cherry jam, milk chocolate and anise. A fine grilled steak will do it justice.
title: Matanzas Creek 2010 Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: This is a light and fruity wine that has an attractive smoky aroma and black currant acidity. The result is a fresh, juicy wine with a crisp texture and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink now. Screwcap.
title: Fritsch 2010 Red Soil Zweigelt (Wagram-Donauland)

description: Aromas of blue flower, dark-skinned fruit, brown spice and grilled bell pepper come together in the glass. The palate offers dried black cherry, prune, espresso, coconut and a toasted note alongside tightly knit tannins. It's starting to dry up so drink soon.
title: Castelvecchio 2010 Vigna La Quercia Riserva  (Chianti Colli Fiorentini)

description: From Napa and Sonoma in equal measure, this wine is herbal, slightly green, while also dense, syrupy and mouth-coating in tannins.
title: Evoke 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)

description: This wine offers assertive aromas of plum, mint and cherry, and on the palate, easygoing red berry and vanilla flavors. Tannins are smooth and the mouthfeel velvety. A friendly, tasty red with class. Pair with stew, grilled lamb, robust cheeses.
title: Cederberg 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Cederberg)

description: An easy Pinot that shows the variety's silky texture ripe, with sunny flavors of cherries and cola. It's ripe, and fine for drinking now.
title: Alouette 2011 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This blend is comprised of all five classic Bordeaux varieties, but unusually, led by Petit Verdot. The wine is inky dark and tannic with extracted blackberry flavors. High alcohol gives it a burn from the midpalate through the finish.
title: Hendry 2009 Red Red (Napa Valley)

description: Here's a very rich and full-bodied wine. It does have structure, giving firm tannins to balance the ripe red berry fruits. With this solid character, the wine will age and should be drunk from 2016.
title: Château Barrail Chevrol 2011  Fronsac

description: A veritable bouquet of jasmine and orange blossoms, this off-dry Gewürztraminer hits the tongue with a delightful prickle of effervescence. Soft and rich with juicy melon and peach flavors, it finishes on a sweet, spicy iced tea note.
title: Prejean 2009 Semi-Dry Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)

description: This feels light and rather dilute. It has varietal pepper and some spice, but the main effect is one of acidity, crispness and freshness. The lychee tropical fruit element is underplayed in favor of crispness. It should certainly work with food.
title: Dopff & Irion 2004 Les Maquisards Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Tropical fruit and vanilla-cookie aromas come with a note of nectarine. This feels juicy, racy and citric, with flavors of tangerine and nectarine. Despite having tangy acidity, the wine turns heavy on the finish.
title: Zuccardi 2012 Serie A Chardonnay (Uco Valley)

description: This wine is plush, with aromas of blueberry, blackberry and cranberry. There are also hints of sage and red currant on the nose. The palate has more cranberry—but a bit sour—along with tart cherry and charred oak, all framed by astringent tannins and mouthwatering acidity. The finish is flavorful, but short.
title: Veramar NV Rooster Red (Virginia)

description: This intriguing blend of 50% Grenache and 50% Carignan combines crisp red-fruit flavors and lush, creamy tannins. There's a slightly herbal tinge as well. Drink it over the next year or two.
title: Les Vignerons D'Estezargues 2010 Terre de Mistral Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Made from Castelão grapes, this crisp wine has red fruits that burst out of the glass and give a lively aftertaste, with tight acidity. Drink now.
title: Manzwine 2015 Rosé (Lisboa)

description: A blend of Grenache and Syrah, this is slightly minty upfront, followed by bright cherry flavors. It's on the light side for a Côtes du Rhône, but fresh and silky in texture, with just a hint of chocolaty richness on the finish.
title: Perrin & Fils 2010 Nature Red Wine Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: This fruity, soft wine is ready to drink. With apple and pear flavors, just the right amount of crisp acidity and a bright aftertaste, it's made for this summer.
title: Moura Basto 2013 White (Tejo)

description: Absolutely dry and tingly in acidity, this citrus-flavored wine is clean and zesty. It's a fine appetizer sipper for cleansing the palate. Serve it with little munchies, like grilled veggies, goat cheese and crackers with crab salad.
title: Oak Grove 2009 Reserve Pinot Grigio (California)

description: A spicy wine, with nutmeg and allspice as well as peppered plums. Against this exotic background, the tannins are solid and concentrated, suggesting good aging potential.
title: Château Laride 2011 L'Iris de Laride  Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc)

description: Too sugary sweet by far, which is partly the result of very high alcohol but may also be due to some residual sugar. The sweetness draws attention to the oak, and makes it taste stronger than it really is. Despite flavors of blackberries, blueberries and mocha, this wine is too Porty and unbalanced.
title: Terra d'Oro 2006 Deaver Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: Named after an Arabic battle cry and now an expression that's shouted at wine festivals, the wine is lightly wood aged, ripe although with a stalky edge. It's easy and ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Conde 2016 Algazarra Red (Lisboa)

description: Fresh, crisp and minerally on the nose, this has green apple and melon aromas. It feels fresh, juicy, light and refreshing, with high-toned white-fruit flavors as well as notes of grapefruit, herb and lime. Clean on the finish.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León
title: El Pensador 2011 Verdejo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)

description: Black cherry and dark raspberry fruit blend with background citrus accents, leading into a vibrant but short finish. Drink now; may also be served slightly chilled.
title: Abarbanel 2006 Château de la Salle Kosher  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This is a nicely constructed Shiraz with some cool-climate leanings. It's medium in weight, with smoky scents, plum and cherry fruit and a firm, mouthwatering finish.
title: Eden Road 2010 Shiraz (Gundagai)

description: This easy-drinking wine boasts sensations of tart green apple, ripe Bartlett pear and juicy pineapple. The succulent palate is supported by crisp acidity that gives it a clean, refreshing finish.
title: Sallier de la Tour 2013 Inzolia (Sicilia)

description: Simple citrus freshness brightens nose and palate, the refreshment factor enhanced by ample spritz. This will make an ideal light-bodied and fun apéritif on a hot day. Drink soon.
title: Felsner 2014 Lössterrassen Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This is a green, lean and somewhat sour wine, with an herbal personality that lies atop a world of smooth tannins.
title: Rutherford Hill 2011 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: This is drinkable but not overly interesting, with a good berry flavor. It's marked with an off-putting aroma of cigarette ash, and it feels raw.
title: Lucky Star 2011 Petite Sirah (California)

description: Scents of leather and turbinado sugar surface on the nose first, which are offset by accents of blackberry, forest floor and pepper. The medium-to-full palate feels supple and expansive, until the finish where the tannic muscle kicks in. Overall, the flavors are intense and juicy but come with an edge of prune.
title: North Gate 2010 Meritage (Virginia)

description: A deliciously fresh wine, the bright acidity coming from green fruit and peaches. A creamy character adds a sense of roundness, but there is a crisp, taut aftertaste.
title: Kopke 2010 Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: There's a shrillness to this wine, rich in overripe, preserved lemon and a daunting taste and aroma of oak. The body and weight of the wine don't overpower, but the fruit and oak don't seem in balance.
title: Frog's Leap 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Lots of raisins, prunes and heavy baking spice show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling, as well as hints of black pepper and shredded asphalt. Exotic figs and prunes also make an appearance on the palate, which is framed by a decent tannic grip.
title: Leoness 2013 Fitzpatrick Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
