description: Vanilla, pear and a whiff of wintergreen make the nose intriguing, but after that it's commercial mango and pineapple flavors with a pithy finish. A sweet, overpumped Chardonnay.
title: Santa Alicia 2009 Reserva Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Sulphuric at first, with citrus and air freshener aromas. The palate has a certain roundness and fleshy quality, while the flavors are sweet, melony and a little oily. Some almond-skin bitterness rises up late, most likely reflecting the 25% Viognier in the blend.
title: Zuccardi 2010 Serie A Chardonnay-Viognier (Mendoza)

description: Grapy aromas suggest minerals and iodine along with wet animal fur and plum. It's firm and tannic on the palate, with herbal, rooty plum and berry flavors and a tight finish.
title: Zuccardi 2015 Serie A Malbec (Valle de Uco)

description: A consistent performer from year to year, Villa Maria's 2009 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc hints at asparagus, which kept my enthusiasm a little more limited than in the past. But there's ample grapefruit and bright Green Gage plum on the finish.
title: Villa Maria 2009 Private Bin Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Robust, peppery, dry and fruity, just what an inexpensive Shiraz should be. Easy to like for its array of blackberries, spices and cedar. A great value in a barbecue-style wine.
title: Black Box 2009 Shiraz (California)

description: With 40% Grenache, 40% Syrah, 20% Carignan and no oak aging, this is a fresh and juicy wine with characteristics of black cherry, black berry, thyme, Asian spice and cola. Solid acidity and a medium finish make this an easy pleaser.
title: Château du Donjon 2007 Grande Tradition Red (Minervois)

description: This is a wood-aged wine that has some weight. There's a strong toast character from the wood, contrasting with the ripe plum flavor.
title: Robert Klingenfus 2010 Cuvée Elodie Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A fresh-faced rosé, with a rose-grey color, this has red fruit acidity and an attractive, creamy character to go with the crisp finish.
title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2011 VieVité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Winemaker Madeleine Jautard has produced a soft, juicy wine, packed with ripe fruits. There is a touch of spice as well to give the wine its structure. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château Haut la Pointe 2014  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Juicy black cherry and berry notes are layered in heady tones of char, tobacco leaf and cedar in this easy drinking entry-level Pinot. Ruddy ripeness is balanced out neatly by brisk acidity. It's a tad lean in concentration with a brisk finish.
title: Dr. Heyden 2014 Oppenheimer Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: Overtly sweet, this Cab tastes like melted blackberry and cherry jam.
title: Lockwood 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)

description: Saucy plum and berry aromas are a touch stewy and gritty. This wine shows a blocky body with sinewy tannins. Savory, saucy flavors match the bouquet, and it feels supple and tastes roasted on the finish.
title: Viña Mayor 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)

description: This luminous Greco di Tufo offers pretty aromas of peach, vanilla, banana and light mineral shadings. It's easy and fresh in the mouth with lime and citrus flavors that characterize its crisp close. A Marc de Grazia selection, various American importers.
title: Benito Ferrara 2007  Greco di Tufo

description: Named after an ancestor of the present owner who became a saint, this wine is soft, spicy and smoky, although with excessive acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Cadaval 2013 Vinha Padre Pedro Red (Tejo)

description: Straightforward Tempranillo aromas and flavors mark this light red. The dry berry-cherry fruit is offset by smoke, leather and rosemary notes. It's slightly and typically on the astringent side, but turns a bit raspy on the modest finish. —M.M.
title: J. Garcia Carrion 2000 Antaño  (Rioja)

description: La Vis's Dipinti series has preformed well thanks to attractive pricing. This expression of Sauvignon offers evident herbal characteristics, as well as mineral ones. Think chopped sage and basil and drying white stone.
title: La Vis 2005 Dipinti Sauvignon (Trentino)

description: Claret is the old British term for the wines of Bordeaux. This wine, the first such from Francis Ford Coppola's Sonoma County winery, is a good buy. It's a bit rustic, but offers smooth flavors of blackberries, currants and chocolate.
designation: Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Black Label Claret
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2006 Francis Coppola Diamond Collection Black Label Claret Red (California)

description: Tasty in a tart way, with licorice hints, this well-balanced, medium-weight red shows plenty of herb-tinged, sour cherry flavor. Good acidity and moderate tannins make this a good match for grilled veal. Think Claret, but from southern Spain. Drink now–2004. Best Buy. —M.M.
title: Castillo Catadau 1996 Reserva Red (Valencia)

description: This hearty blend of Montepulciano, Uva di Troia and Aglianico delivers rock-solid structure and sweet-smelling aromas of Graham cracker, cinnamon, rhubarb and burnt popcorn. It's an intense wine with a strange combination of aromas.
title: Agrinatura 2006 Giancarlo Ceci Red (Castel del Monte)

description: Strong tarry and asphalt notes show on the nose of this wine, with a touch of boysenberry. Similar elements play into the somewhat rough palate, where tarry tannins interplay with tart boysenberry, bolstered slightly by a touch of soy.
title: Balderdash 2012 Brakelight Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: A little too soft for aging, but ultra-refined, with complex cherry, red currant, balsam, cola and mushroom flavors. It's very dry and ready to drink now, despite some hard tannins.
title: Joseph Carr 2010 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Mint and licorice aromas combine to give a medicinal impression that fortunately is not confirmed on the palate. In the mouth, it's ripe and mostly fresh, with flavors of plum, cassis and blackberry. The finish is round and smooth, with more mint. Solid and racy if not overly stylish.
title: Morandé 2001 Vitisterra Grand Reserve Syrah (Maipo Valley)

description: Dominated by grapefruit and pineapple flavors, this is very fresh and herbaceous. The wine is crisp and clean, with acidity at the end. Drink over the next year.
title: Château Lauretan 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Savory on the nose and palate, with persistent dill, coconut and vanilla notes, there's an abundance of American oak on this wine. Medium bodied, this is creamy and oaky on the palate, with a slightly-bitter herb finish.
title: Thousand Islands Winery 2010 Chardonnay (New York)

description: Made with organically farmed fruit, this hearty Chianti Superiore opens with a muddled bouquet that sees overlapping fruit, almond and earth aromas. The mouthfeel, however, is rich and penetrating.
title: La Traiana 2008  Chianti Superiore

description: Aromas of toast, oak, earth and berry lead the way. The lean palate is rather diluted, showing dried cherry and hints of black pepper and espresso. Dusty, rather fleeting tannins leave a mouth drying finish.
title: Nicodemi 2014 Le Murate  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: This is crisp, clean and light. It is fruity with green apple flavor, and it has a tight texture. The finish is floral and aromatic. Screwcap.
title: Markus Huber 2011 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This Manzoni (a cross between Riesling and Pinot Bianco) opens with a pretty, luminous glow and offers pristine aromas of stone fruit, mango and vanilla. Natural structure and smoothness underscore the variety's pairing potential with most Thai or Indian dishes.
title: Masottina 2006 Incrocio Manzoni 6.0.13 Manzoni (Colli Trevigiani)

description: Sweet as sin on the nose, with a ton of barrel-driven spice, resin and vanilla. The palate is full, creamy and resiny in feel, with more oak than anything on the flavor profile. There's baked apple and spice too, while the finish is severely oaky.
title: Santa Ema 2010 Amplus Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)

description: Made with Sangiovese, Sagrantino, Barbera, Merlot and Cabernet, this wine opens with dominant oak aromas that carry through to the palate alongside subdued notes of prune and fig. It lacks fruit richness and freshness to support the oak.
title: Adanti 2009  Montefalco Rosso

description: A great value wine, this fruity Syrah opens with bright blueberry, cherry and plum woven between subtle nuances of leather, spice and smoked bacon.
title: Tasca d'Almerita 2009 Sallier de la Tour Syrah (Sicilia)

description: A little too jammy, with pineapple, apricot and vanilla spice flavors. The sweetness is balanced with lemony acidity, but it's not really a dry table wine.
title: Opolo 2006 Roussanne (Central Coast)

description: A very uncommon California version of a grape originally from Southern France, this shows broad and welcoming aromas of cranberry-raspberry juice, light purple flowers and cola. Served with a slight chill, it goes down easy, with plump plums and root-beer spice.
title: J. Lohr 2014 Wildflower Valdiguié (Monterey)

description: Tropical aromas are typical for basic Chilean Chardonnay. This is plump in feel, with cantaloupe, honeydew and chunky apple flavors. The palate feels balanced and the wine is just focused enough on the finish, which shows a spot of bracing acidity. Drink right away.
title: Caliterra 2012 Reserva Estate Grown Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Aromas of tangerine zest, peach and flower are followed by dry clean fruit flavors that show no apparent oak influence, with citrus notes lingering on the finish.
title: Airfield Estates 2015 Viognier (Yakima Valley)

description: Fragrant floral tones will remind you of orange and almond blossoms. This perky Prosecco delivers sweet fruit flavors of stone fruit and citrus backed by cooling acidity and subtle sweetness. Le Colture is one of the best producers in Valdobbiadene.
title: Le Colture NV Cruner Dry  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: Basic apple and yeast aromas are fairly neutral but clean. This feels fresh, fruity and simple. Lemon-lime and apple flavors finish clean as well as cleansing.
title: Chic Barcelona NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)

description: This soft wine is yeasty with a strong bubbly mousse. It is balanced, moving towards the sweet end of Brut although with plenty of apple acidity to keep it crisp. Drink the wine now.
title: Nicolas Feuillatte NV Brut  (Champagne)

description: Aromas of syrupy red cherry, vanilla and mint meld with touches of blackberry and pepper. The wine delivers notable concentration, plush texture and a lingering finish.
title: Cooper's Hawk NV Shiraz (America)

description: Raisiny and earthy on the nose, this Bonarda also offers damp aromas of fern and tobacco. Chunky, with a soft, flat palate, this tastes raisiny and stewed. Low acidity and raisiny flavors on the finish are consistent with what came before.
title: Durigutti 2014 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: A hard wine to like, although it's clean and without technical flaws. Tastes very oaky now, with hard grapeskin and oak tannins giving an astringency to the superripe blackberry and cherry jelly flavors.
title: Ty Caton 2006 Caton Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: This wine opens with tertiary aromas of damp earth and mineral, along with notes of brown-banana peel and beeswax. The palate shows a loss of fruit richness and oxidation.
title: Barberani 2012 VINOSO VIni NO SOlfiti  (Orvieto Classico)

description: A fruity red, with jammy plum flavors and a smooth texture. The wine shows some of the elegance for which Taylor Fladgate is famed, while also offering a rich aftertaste.
title: Taylor Fladgate NV Fine Ruby  (Port)

description: Pungent pyrazine-heavy aromas of bell pepper and asparagus are typical for this winery. A chunky palate is oily in feel, while vegetal-leaning, green flavors of pickled citrus fruits end with a salty note.
title: Casas del Bosque 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Smoky tones of ripe blackberry and raspberry set the stage and offer sweet, caramel-like flavors along the way. Background aromas include dried herbs and black olive and the wine ends with a fresh, menthol-like finish.
title: Cantine Barbera 2007 Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: Give this Merlot some time to breathe before serving. Right out of the bottle, it's tough, gritty and tannic. It will never be a mellow wine, but it does have nice black-cherry and licorice flavors.
title: Donati 2010 Merlot (Paicines)

description: This Godello is almost like water in color, while the nose is neutral and fruitless. A dilute, scattershot palate shows bland, oxidized flavors of bready white fruits.
title: Adrás 2013 Godello (Ribeira Sacra)

description: Produced by the largest Bordeaux cooperative, this is a freshly fruity wine, with simple red fruit flavors and soft tannins. There is a smoky edge and pink raspberry acidity.
title: Univitis 2009 Chevalier de Saint-André  (Bordeaux)

description: A first bottle was obviously off. A second was better, although still lacking the complexity you want at this price. It was a young Cab, dry and tannic, with a core of cassis and cherries. A few years in the cellar should soften it.
title: St. Clement 2004 Star Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Ripe and tropical, this is a full wine that captures the warmth of the Alentejo. The acidity offers some freshness along with the citrus edge, but the fruits are much more tropical, rich in mango and lychee spice.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2007 Defesa White White (Alentejano)

description: Should Bordeaux be 14%? Maybe, but not this wine. It is too big, dry, tannin-dominated and heavy. There is way too much extraction, and it shows in the bitter character.
title: Château de Parenchère 2009 Cuvée Raphaël  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

description: There's a lifeless, generic quality to this wine that steals the variety's more common sense of joy and earthy red fruit, but it suffices as general red wine.
title: Pedroncelli 2013 Signature Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a dark bomber with black cherry, kirsch, lemony oak and shoe polish aromas. The palate is creamy and big, with acid-derived lift boosting blackberry and licorice flavors. With tons of black-fruit character, this qualifies as a fruit-forward wine with sweet overtones.
designation: El Chaparral de Vega Sindoa Old Vines
title: Vega Sindoa 2010 El Chaparral de Vega Sindoa Old Vines Garnacha (Navarra)

description: This begins with aromas of overripe plum, nail polish remover, fig, raisin, nutmeg, vanilla, resin and sweet oak. The dense, warm palate delivers chocolate, coffee, vanilla, plum and sweet oak alongside searing alcohol. It's already tired and evolved, and almost past its prime.
title: Torlasco 2009  Barolo

description: This straightforward white opens with aromas of chamomile flower and mature orchard fruit that carry over to the ripe simple palate along with yellow apple. A hint of dried herb marks the close.
title: Monte del Frà 2015  Soave Classico

description: Very ripe and almost sweet in jammy, pie-filling cherries and raspberries, with a rich seasoning of cinnamon, brown sugar and cocoa. But it's technically dry, and has a crispness from fine Arroyo Seco acidity. Drink now.
title: J. Lohr 2007 Fog's Reach Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: Beets, mint and cola mark the aromas of this robust offering from the southern part of the state. It’s rich and corpulent—almost Port-like in its dimensions—and although it lacks a bit of elegance, it certainly possesses plenty of mouth-filling flavor.
title: Bridgeview 1998 Reserve Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

description: This charming blend of Vermentino, Trebbiano and Grechetto opens with pretty aromas of white spring flowers, tropical fruit and peach. The palate offers apricot, pear and citrus flavors, ending with a refreshing finish.
title: Lungarotti 2012 Torre di Giano White (Umbria)

description: A full and solid wine with some leather and robust oak on the nose backed by racier cherry and plum flavors. The mnouthfeel and balance are both good, and overall the wine is packed to its core with berry boldness and choppy, serious tannins.
title: Chilcas 2005 Colina Negra Cabernet Sauvignon (Maule Valley)

description: This is a straightfoward, plummy, grapy red wine. It's medium in body but rather simple, ending on a slightly astringent, chalky note. Ecocert.
title: Famille Perrin 2013 Nature Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Sweet red berry fruits come through the firmer tannins. An unusual blend of Pinot Noir and Touriga Nacional, it has plenty of acidity, delicious juiciness and touches of wood at the end. It's not for long-term aging, ready to drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2011 Terra de Touros Red (Tejo)

description: The winery's larger-production blend of several vineyard sources, given 20 months in American oak, this wine opens in pungent earth, soy and mushroom, reminiscent of a beef bouillon or beef stew. Big tannins surround the fruit, accented in black licorice and black coffee before finishing lean.
title: Sequoia Grove 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Floral blueberry and inky aromas make for a concentrated, demanding bouquet. This four-grape blend is grabby and raw in feel, with pinching tannins. Briny, medicinal plum and berry flavors finish with a note of latex as well as heat.
title: Clos Mont-Blanc 2011 Xipella Red (Catalunya)

description: A perfumed, fruity wine, Lange Ried, or “Long Vineyard,” is a textured and lightly minerally Riesling, with a concentrated white-fruit flavor and a crisp finish.
title: Pratsch 2011 Lange Ried Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: On the surface, this smells of green apple and citrus, although deeper digging reveals pickled briny scents. A pinched citric palate and dry bitter flavors of green fruits and almond skins finish mild and slightly bitter.
title: Las Colinas Del Ebro 2015 Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)

description: There are interesting aromatic layers here that include spring flowers, stone fruit, white mineral and dried herbs or grass. This Prosecco Extra Dry comes together well and offers piquant effervescence and crisp acidity that keeps the palate refreshed.
title: Bellussi NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)

description: Made with Sangiovese and Merlot, this soft, fruity wine offers juicy black cherry, raspberry and the faintest hint of baking spice. It's easy-drinking and accessible, thanks to fresh acidity and round tannins. Drink now.
title: Poggio Borgoni 2013 Red (Toscana)

description: Aromas arise slowly, though toasted oak, struck match and slightly sour fruits do emerge eventually. Flavors are straightforward, with scorched lemon and apple sauce.
title: Manzoni 2013 North Highlands Cuvee Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Fruity berry takes on jammy fullness on the palate in this supremely ripe wine. Dotted in leather, vanilla and cinnamon, its finish is a touch rough.
title: Silver Veil 2014 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: This smooth, creamy textured wine combines bright acidity with ripe apricot and pear flavors. It is already attractive in its freshness while also having a rounder character. Drink now.
title: Domaine Uby 2014 No. 3 Colombard-Ugni Blanc Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: With superripe flavors of prunes and chocolate-covered raisins, this Cab Franc lacks the cherried gracefulness you want in the variety. It turns porty in the finish, with high alcohol and caramelized brown sugar.
title: Mounts 2010 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: A brooding note of espresso jumps from the glass and conceals any fruit that sits below. Formidable tannins would serve as a great complement to grilled game. Flavors of espresso, chocolate and licorice dominate the palate.
title: Cooper Vineyards 2010 Carter Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon (Virginia)

description: Making wine since 961, Pietrafitta presents a crisp, fresh Vernaccia that shows the best characteristics of this historic white wine from Tuscany. Lemongrass, kiwi and peach aromas rise to the front of the bouquet.
title: Pietrafitta 2009  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

description: This lightweight wine is dominated by juicy red fruit. Fresh in character, it has bright acids and soft tannins. Not a wine for aging.
title: Château des Combes 2010  Bordeaux

description: Plummy and savory, this plump, supple-textured wine is a blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Mourvèdre. It offers an easygoing mouthful of fruit in an early-drinking style.
title: Domaine Pierre Usseglio et Fils 2008 Red (Côtes du Rhône)

description: Leesy vanilla aromas give this Garnacha Blanca a cookie-like nose. Plump and round across the palate, this tastes pithy like citrus peel, with a mildly bitter aftertaste. A simple finish doesn't offer anything new.
title: Celler Bàrbara Forés 2014 Blanc Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)

description: A very oaky nose leads into a tough, tannic wine. There's good fruit under all the wood and tannin, and the tight, rugged finish should smooth out in time.
title: Windsor 1997 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Mendocino)

description: Extraordinarily high alcohol is the defining reality of this wine. It gives it a burn in the mouth, like cognac, only without the richness. The currant and spice flavors are nicely dry, but that high alcohol accentuates the tannins.
title: Hanna 2012 Bismark Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)

description: This wine has a dancing, delicate nature. Aromas of apricot and honey are followed by floral, apricot and honey flavors. Elegant and friendly with balanced sugar and acid.
title: Niagara Landing 2007 Ice Wine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Escarpment)

description: Poised, stylish and very fruity, this wine is fresh with acidity, showing lemon and red currant, with a touch of pepper on the finish. It's just right as an apéritif.
title: Domaines Bunan 2014 Bunan Selection Rosé (Var)

description: An off-dry Chenin Blanc with attractive honey and spice flavors along with fresh, clean acidity. It's an easy aperitif wine, its soft flavors just hinting at some dryness, but finishing crisply. Screwcap.
title: Caves du Val de France 2007 Jovly  (Vouvray)

description: Fairly neutral on the nose, but clean and easy to get into. The palate offers good acidity and vitality for Maule SB, with tropical fruit leading the flavor profile followed by pithy green notes. Overall this is a good value white.
title: Viña Requingua 2010 Puerto Viejo Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)

description: Cherry and cassis aromas are bright and bring an animal note. An energetic palate hosts plum, berry and herbal flavors, while a forward-charging finish is fiery and leaves a palpable herbal aftertaste.
title: Argento 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Gritty aromas of sulfur and matchstick come with citrus and field-like scents. A round but lively palate with lemon and sulfuric bitterness finishes green, briny and juicy. This wine is plump and oily, but with enough zest to maintain balance.
designation: Del Viento Paredones Estate Single Vineyard
title: Estampa 2014 Del Viento Paredones Estate Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: This is typical Pinot Blanc—its warm, fruity and soft with just a touch of spice. The wine has an attractive line of acidity from its pear flavors, making it balanced and ready to drink.
title: Dopff & Irion 2012 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: The quintessential summer sipping wine, this opens with fresh aromas of citrus, white flower and stone fruit. It follows to the palate with foamy bubbles and a bright touch of acidity.
title: Villa Sandi NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: This opens with aromas that recall acacia flower, chamomile and a whiff of beeswax. The zesty palate offers grapefruit, green apple and hint of white almond alongside racy acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
title: Marotti Campi 2014 Luzano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)

description: Dry and zesty in acidity, this Chard offers flavors of apricots, green apples, pears and butter cream. It's pretty good for this everyday price.
title: Concannon 2007 Selected Vineyards Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: This is a robust, ripe and fruity Zinfandel that impresses for the sheer exuberance of its flavors. They range from black cherries and red currants to cola, chocolate, black pepper and the sweet, glyceriney taste of high alcohol.
title: Stephen & Walker 2007 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Slightly unripe, with an herbaceousness that interferes with the blackberries and currants, making the oak stick out uncomfortably. Sharp, too. But it's good and richly tannic, and dry. Made from all five traditional Bordeaux varieties.
title: Trefethen 2007 Double T Red (Oak Knoll District)

description: The fermentation of this white Pinot, which eliminates skin contact (hence color), also removes any hint of varietal flavor. In other words, this tastes not at all like regular, red Pinot Noir. It's more along the lines of a stainless-steel-fermented Chardonnay, with that grape's simple neutrality first and foremost.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2014 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The blend is 60% Grenache from the Stone Tree vineyard, the rest Syrah from Stillwater Creek and LVdM vineyards. It's forward, fragrant and fruity, with notes of tanned leather. Bright berry fruit shines through into a finish with moderate tannins.
title: :Nota Bene 2010 Una Notte Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This bright, easygoing wine is endowed with fragrant violet, iris, red berry and tilled soil aromas. The sleek, no-frills palate offers crushed red berry, white pepper and a hint of coffee alongside lively acidity and limber tannins. It's simple but well made. Drink through 2017.
title: Fattoria di Valiano 2013  Chianti Classico

description: This bright wine has aromas that suggest citrus blossom and tropical fruit. The lively, slender palate shows crunchy Granny Smith apple and pineapple accompanied by brisk acidity.
title: Dorigo 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)

description: This vineyard-designate Valpolicella exhibits aromas of dried rose petal, bee's wax and lavender soap. It's a fresh and easygoing wine with a relaxing personality and loads of charm.
title: Tommasi 2006 Vigneto Rafaèl  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore)

description: The nose on this red blend from Hungary is so inviting with its balanced wave of warming spices, red berry and pepper. But on the palate, there's a note of hard cherry candy sweetness and tartness and a lack of overall dimension that keeps a good wine from being great.
title: Áldás 2005 Egri Bikavér Red (Eger)

description: The nose on this Cabernet Franc seduces with scents of rich, ripe berries and cherries accented with granite, vanilla and spice. The palate, however, is more reserved with a dusty, earthen tone that seeps into ruddy red-fruit flavors. Brisk and medium-bodied, it finishes moderately long.
title: Heron Hill 2011 Ingle Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)

description: Hot, syrupy aromas are rooty and intense. This Nebbiolo offers plum, raspberry and red currant flavors offset by tomato and noticeable oak. The finish is propelled by acidity and carries tangy flavors of roasted tomato and plum.
title: Dubacano 2010 Nebbiolo (Valle de Guadalupe)

description: The nose seems a touch reduced and nutty, but airing unveils sweet blackberry aromas and then candied, creamy berry fruit flavors. There isn't quite the body and structure that 125 has the potential to deliver, but it's still solid, well oaked and moderately tannic.
title: Bodegas Julián Chivite 2002 Coleccion 125 Reserva Red (Navarra)

description: Nice and welcoming on the nose, with melon, citrus and other punchbowl aromas. The palate is graced with fine acidity, which amplifies the wine's standard green apple and lime flavors. Clean and showing no glaring issues. Textbook everyday Chilean SB; we could drink this stuff forever.
title: Montes 2008 Classic Series Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Juicy and spicy flavors give a wine that layers fruit and ginger. Blackberries are the dominant fruit while the spice adds a bite that is almost exotic.
title: Château Crusquet Sabourin 2012  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Almost overripe peach notes dominate the nose. Far more sprightly, the palate has a phenolic, textured note of citrus pith with a pleasantly bitter aspect. The finish is warm but fresh.
title: Leon Beyer 2015 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Showing definite maturity, this remains a solid, chunky wine. It has richness as well as a light structure of acidity and raspberries. It is very ready to drink now.
title: Loron et Fils 2005 Réserve Caveau Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-à-Vent)

description: This is fruity, fragrant and fresh. It has creamed pear and tangy orange flavors that are laced with bright acidity. The crisp lime note gives a final refreshing burst.
title: Cave de Kientzheim-Kaysersberg 2010 The Furst Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: This wine's nose is all about earth and minerality, showing iron, rust, mushrooms and eucalyptus, but in a rather pungent way. The flavors are sanguine, nearly metallic, with Indian spices and cranberry fruit combining for a sip that is lean in body but grippy with tannins.
title: Summerland 2013 Vintner's Select Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Leathery berry aromas are wiry and come with a hit of lemony oak. The palate is tightly focused by staunch acids, while flavors of tart berry, red plum, oak spice and pepper end with scouring bite and a note of anise. This is 85% Tempranillo with Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot.
title: Finca Albret 2008 Reserva Red (Navarra)

description: Boasts tremendously ripe fruit—the stated alcohol level is 15.5%—yet doesn't seem overly hot or bulky. As you might expect, the tannins are soft, while the flavors of cassis pick up hints of cola, earth and tobacco. Despite the ripeness, there's a streak of tangy acidity that holds everything together. Drink now.
title: Craneford 2006 Allyson Parsons Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)

description: Smells waxy, as if it has slipped past its prime. The palate still sports a beam of bright acidity but there isn't much body or lees to accompany the richness, so the volume is low as a whole. Tastes good, but mostly like citrus and fresh fruit juice.
title: Fillaboa 2009 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: The historic Port house of Delaforce has now launched its own Douro table wines, and this Alvarinho is soft and fruity. It has a creamy initial texture followed by touches of vanilla and quince. This is not for aging, so drink it now.
title: Delaforce 2011 Alvarinho (Duriense)

description: From the Aube region in the south of Champagne, this is a rich and soft wine, on the sweet side for a Brut. It has a warm feeling to it, ripe and with apricot and apple fruit flavors. Rounded and full in the mouth, it is ready to drink.
designation: Grande Tradition Blanc de Noirs Brut
title: Dautel-Cadot NV Grande Tradition Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Rusty in color for a young wine, with mulchy, faded berry fruit aromas. It has life on the palate, which tastes earthy, peppery and a little bit burnt. A dry, spicy wine with cherry flavors interspersed.
title: Palo Alto 2010 Coiron Merlot (Maipú)

description: There's a disagreeable sharpness and harshness to this Merlot. Despite some pleasant cherry, berry and oak flavors and a lush texture, that rough tartness persists through the finish.
title: Bell 2004 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Vibrant aromas of lychee, white flowers and spice lead to elegant off-dry flavors. It brings easy-drinking enjoyment but the concentration seems a bit lacking.
title: Hogue 2015 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: While the aroma is a touch earthy, the flavors in this full-bodied and plush-textured wine resemble honey, peach and almond. With a hint of sweetness to round out the mouthfeel, this could be a good match for a wide variety of cheeses.
title: Naggiar 2014 Mamma Mia White (Sierra Foothills)

description: A vanilla aroma is followed by old oak flavors and sweetly textured fruits. Not a wine for aging, this is already soft and fruity.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Vintage  (Port)

description: The wood aging is still showing in this young wine that needs time. Dry, firm and toasty, it also has the light, fruity character of the 2013 vintage with raspberry, blueberry and acidity that's still too intense. Drink from 2016.
title: Producta Vignobles 2013 Château de Laborde  (Bordeaux)

description: Ripe, juicy berries dominate the nose, getting some aromatic lift from hints of eucalyptus and menthol. The mint and red fruit of cherries consume the straight-forward palate, which is more bright and lean than rich and tannic.
title: Sextant 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Fleshy, tropical aromas with a touch of varietal snap set up a green palate with sweet lime and scallion flavors. The finish shows ripeness and tropical notes before turning heavy. Drink this well chilled.
title: Undurraga 2012 U Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)

description: Bottled unfiltered, this wine shows some carbonic tendencies, a wildness of strawberry punch and sharp acidity. Light bodied and restrained, it is softly layered and subtle in oak.
title: Robert James Wines 2014 Pinnacle Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dusty and dry, this wine uses a higher percentage of Sangiovese than Luce and the result is a tougher, more austere wine that gets much of its character from dried spice and toast. Understated and restrained, you can almost taste the influence of co-creator Tim Mondavi.
title: Lucente 1999 Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: This is an oak aged wine that is trying too hard. It's only toast and juicy acidity from wood. It could possibly fill out with fruit although that is unlikely.
title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 Pluma Reserva Alvarinho (Minho)

description: Tropical mango and pineapple flavors give this attractive wine an exotic character. It does have some herbaceous character but it is more about ripe fruits and a light texture. Drink now.
title: Paul Buisse 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: A disappointment after the rich 2005. They should have declassified this vintage. The wine is dry and sharp, with green, sharp acids and modest berry, currant and herb flavors.
title: Emilio's Terrace 2006 Sophie's Rows Red (Oakville)

description: This oddly named Cabernet Sauvignon is fine. It has light tannins, a juicy, stalky character, upfront black currant fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Romantic Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)

description: The second wine of Château Fonplégade is fresh and bright with good fruits, berry flavors and some richness. It has good poise; ready to drink in 2–3 years.
title: Château Fonplégade 2007 Fleur de Fonplégade  (Saint-Émilion)

description: Hot in high alcohol, with Port-like flavors of superripe currants and dark chocolate, finished with a raisinskin bitterness.
title: Wilson 2007 Carl's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: There's a soft and plush side to this edition of Moma that comes forward thanks to the extra cinnamon spice and vanilla present on the bouquet. Red berry fruit and cherry add a note of freshness to the finish.
title: Umberto Cesari 2011 Moma Red (Rubicone)

description: Light, fresh and easy wine, with pear and green apple fruit and a deft, soft texture. Totally ready to drink.
title: Château d'Orschwihr 2009 Bollenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: This is forward and fresh, with notes of green apple, gooseberry and lemon-lime on the nose and palate. Zippy and mouthwatering, it has faint suggestions of lime zest and fresh-cut grass on the back.
title: MAN Vintners 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Inspired by fashion icon Versace, this interpretation of Nero d'Avola opens with dense blackberry and blueberry aromas with background tones of spice and almond. This Sicilian estate belongs to the owner of one of Italy's biggest fashion-media groups.
title: Feudi del Pisciotto 2009 Versace Nero d'Avola (Sicilia)

description: Smoke and wood-driven aromas of vanilla, allspice and ground ginger follow fresh tones of lush cherries and blueberries. The wine is silky and smooth and boasts a soft and pleasant quality of tannins.
title: Col d'Orcia 2003  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This luminous sparkler presents enticing aromas of white peach pulp and honeysuckle that are generous and round. This value wine delivers a tonic, firm body accented by lively peachy flavors.
title: Villa Sandi NV Il Fresco  (Prosecco del Veneto)

description: This wine features a unique combination of stone fruit, citrus and chili pepper, making it a treat to pair with piquant dishes like ceviche. It's medium-bodied, but with plenty of freshness and zest on the finish.
title: Waimea 2009 Spinyback Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)

description: This opens with aromas of wet leaves, forest floor, menthol and prune. Made from Alicante and a drop of Montepulciano, the palate delivers mocha, crushed herb, licorice and a fig note alongside evolved tannins. It's already tired, so drink soon.
title: Colle Spinello 2009 Promemoria Red (Toscana)

description: The aromas are bright, with notes of whole cantaloupe, candle wax and ripe sliced banana. The palate is bone dry, with tart, lemony acids providing the structure. Bitters linger on the finish.
title: Barnard Griffin 2016 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a lean and fresh white from northern Italy with drying mineral tones that are followed by fragrant notes of peach, honey and distant herbal aromas. The wine has a lean and crisp close that would pair well with exotic foods.
title: Michele Chiarlo 2007  Roero Arneis

description: Powdery notes, bath oil and white-fruit aromas make for a fragrant nose. This is solid on the palate, with citric acidity and a slight oiliness to the feel. Flowery nectarine and orange flavors set up a weighty but fresh finish. Drink now.
title: Terra do Castelo 2013 Selección White (Ribeiro)

description: While this wine shows its wood aging strongly, it is likely that the fruit will be able to push through the spice and heavy toast as it matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Peuy Saincrit 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Toasty and honeyed in scent, this has aromas of glazed apples and pears, butterscotch and an edge of Meyer lemon zest. Medium to full bodied, the palate is vibrant and expressive, with the lemon note carrying the finish.
title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2011 Founder's Reserve Chardonnay (Shenandoah Valley)

description: Soft and one-dimensional, this red Rhône blend has flavors of cherries, blackberry jam, blueberry pie, chocolate and pepper. There's some bitterness throughout that detracts.
title: Curtis 2005 Heritage Cuvée Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: There is little difference between this and the winery's reserve. There simply is no flavor here. It's a watery, sour wine, with a finish that suggests something went wrong somewhere along the line.
title: Château Bianca 2000 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: A rustic, simple wine, with ripe, sweet cherry and cola flavors. Feels rough and sharp in the mouth, but not bad for the price.
title: Round Hill 2010 Merlot (California)

description: This wine tastes relatively light and easy despite full body. It has aromas like raspberry jam, flavors that are exuberantly fruity, and a feeling of freshness and brightness.
title: Bonterra 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

description: A good value in dry Riesling, this bottling features potent petrol, truffled honey and pineapple notes on the nose, while on the palate it's medium bodied, turning crisp and lean on the finish.
title: Weingut Liebfrauenstift 2010 Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Deep elderberry and Concord-grape fruit tones are cut by cigar box and cedar galore on the nose of this bottling that employs all five red Bordeaux varieties. That woodiness dominates the palate, where juniper and pine sap meet with crushed espresso bean and graphite in the tightly wound structure.
title: Donati 2013 Claret Red (Paicines)

description: This has a soft texture that just allows room for some crisp apple flavors. Otherwise, it is a smooth rounded wine. Its fruitiness and its acidity are part and parcel of this ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Girard 2016 Benoît Girard  (Sancerre)

description: With a light touch of spice and some richness, this is a dry style of Pinot Gris. It has a kiwi fruit flavor along with white fruits, and finishes with pepper. Screwcap.
title: Pierre Sparr 2010 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: This vibrant Roero Arneis from Northern Italy offers a very floral bouquet with layers of citrus blossom, melon and peach. There's a slightly sweet note in the mouth matched by some natural creaminess.
title: Giacosa Fratelli 2009  Roero

description: Simple, attractive crisp wine, with a pleasant depth of flavor. It has fresh fruit, a light toast touch and soft acidity.
title: Tenuta Cà Bolani 2002 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Aquileia)

description: Here is a ripe but well-balanced wine with aromas of cherry, spice, dark chocolate and minerals. The wine boasts a modern edge that is identified by its soft, forthcoming personality and its jammy fruit characteristics. It tastes smooth and rich and would pair with any hearty winter meal.
title: Farnese 2004  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane

description: The aromas start out quite reduced, providing significant distraction. The bell-pepper flavors are light and show a bit of age.
title: Coyote Canyon 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This cuvée is comprised of 43% Syrah, 40% Merlot and 17% Petite Sirah. It exudes black tar and leather, but it's more savory than fruity. Tannic still, showing off the Petite, its finish is long and lingering. This is a good pasta wine.
title: Stuessy Cellars 2010 Principium Cuvee Red (Suisun Valley)

description: Sugared plum, spice, vanilla and herb aromas are followed by off-dry, soft blue-fruit flavors in this wine. It provides easy-drinking pleasure.
title: Original House Wine 2013 The Original Steak House Cabernet Sauvignon (America)

description: Accents of cola spice and cardamom lend a spicy overlay to the black plum and berry core of this wine. It's surprisingly light in weight, with soft tannins and plush, sweet oak-spice tones that dominate the finish.
title: Fortant 2015 Hills Reserve Malbec (Pays d'Oc)

description: Offers heady aromas of mashed peaches, banana, blueberry and walnut. The palate matches the nose in flavors and intensity, but is lifted by the vibrant acidity and somewhat prickly texture. Finishes clean with moderate length.
designation: Famille Grassa Rosé de Pressée Merlot-Syrah-Tannat
region_1: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne
title: Domaine du Tariquet 2007 Famille Grassa Rosé de Pressée Merlot-Syrah-Tannat Rosé (Vin de Pays des Côtes de Gascogne)

description: A combination of dried white currant, green apple and lemon makes for a refreshing, clean palate with a medium, zesty finish.
title: Landhaus Mayer 2013 Riesling (Niederösterreich)

description: Here is a ripe-smelling Primitivo (with 15% Syrah) with cooked notes of red cherry and blackberry backed by smoked bacon, beef jerky and leather. Dried rosemary and oregano also make an appearance and the wine closes with sour, overt tannins.
title: Villa Vignamaggio 2005 Levanter  (Primitivo del Salento)

description: This is a dry wine although the fruit does show potential. It is concentrated and firm, tannins foremost. Drink from 2019.
title: Maison Hebrard 2014 Premium  (Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Somewhat sharp in acids and tannins, with a streak of green mint that weakens the blackberry and cherry flavors. Good structure, but a bit unripe and unbalanced, and not likely to age.
title: Sodaro 2005 Felicity Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: The wine is ripe, rich with full apricot and red apple fruits. It shows a creamy wood-laden character that is spicy and toasty. It's very ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Gensac 2010 Pirouette White (Gers)

description: Dusty apple and papaya aromas lack fortitude. Ditto the palate, which barely stays afloat. Briny citrus flavors and a pickled finish do nothing to elevate this bottom-feeding Chardonnay.
title: Despierta 2014 Chardonnay (La Mancha)

description: Aromas of citrus, green bean and grittiness settle on an even narrower palate, which is lemony and linear in feel and tastes like tart citrus, mostly grapefruit. Lemon and grapefruit flavors linger on a finish that offers no variation.
title: Calcu 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Colchagua Valley)

description: Made in a style to appeal to the masses, this is a soft, sweet Chardonnay. It's rich in vanilla cream, pineapple and orange jam and buttered toast flavors.
title: Handley 2010 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This blend of Trajadura and Alvarinho comes from the far north of the Vinho Verde region. The wine is cool and perfumed with apricot as well as creamed pear flavors. Drink the wine now.
title: Quintas de Melgaço 2016 Blue White (Vinho Verde)

description: Too much extraction has given this wine a dry character. It does have juicy red fruits underneath and these should come out as the wine ages. It is likely, though, always to be a dry wine.
title: Château Barreyre 2013  Bordeaux Supérieur

description: Here's a Barbera from the Monferrato subzone (believed to be the birthplace of this popular indigenous grape) that offers bright, youthful fruit tones and an easy, informal style. The wine is aged in stainless steel to maintain its fruity purity and freshness.
title: Terre d'Aleramo 2009 Fermo  (Barbera del Monferrato)

description: The wood aging dominates this toasty, burnt-flavored wine. The light stalky fruit barely shows. Maybe when the tannins soften in 2015, it will be more approachable.
title: Hubert Meyer 2012 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Dry and rough in texture, with berry, cherry, tobacco, herb and spice flavors wrapped into edgy, slightly green tannins. Turns sharp on the finish, and not likely to age.
title: Williamson Wines 2006 Clarissa Vin Rouge Red (Dry Creek Valley)

description: If the choice is between sleek packaging and good product, take the product every time. And with Garnacha de Fuego, the product is sound to the point of surprising. A bouquet of huge berry aromas is the opening act, followed by flavors of red apple, kirsch and plum. Offers lots of fruit in front of a short, simple finish. And then it's time to open another bottle.
title: Bodegas Ateca 2007 Garnacha de Fuego Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: A very solid wine for the price, this is light in the glass and shows tight cranberry, chipped slate and a slight fruit punch element on the nose. Cranberry returns on the palate, along with raspberries, black pepper and acidity that cuts the rich midpalate.
title: Parker Station 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: From the local Italian word for “to work the soil,” Runcaris represents an easy, fresh expression of Soave Classico with lingering aromas of citrus, yellow rose, honey, jasmine and dried herbs.
title: Fattori 2010 Runcaris  (Soave Classico)

description: This affordable bottling from sustainably minded vineyards is a good everyday dinner wine. It offers violet and blackberry on the nose and a lush feel in the mouth, with black cherry and soft tannins.
title: Esser 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey County)

description: Made from 100% Syrah and aged in 100% new French oak, this wine is currently hard, astringent and oaky, with caramel, vanilla and buttered toast aromas and flavors. The actual Syrah itself is clean and pure in ripe blackberry jam. Might do something over the years, but probably best now, with a decant.
title: Sanguis 2006 Waxing Poetic Syrah (California)

description: The pear, apple and apple skin aromas are light. The palate brings just off-dry pear flavors with a full feel.
title: Sawtooth 2015 Pinot Gris

description: This is a crisp, serviceable Pinot Gris, with sharp green-apple and cut pear fruit dominating. It's got plenty of acid underscoring the fruit, and should work well as an all-purpose wine.
title: Silvan Ridge 2006 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: A rugged, fierce wine, brusque in tannins, that needs big, rich meats and oils to balance it out. Short ribs and similar fare will play well against the blackberry and raisin flavors of this high-alcohol Zin.
title: 6 North 2009 The Big Cat Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This slightly brooding red has a sweet and sour, tart cherry and toasty wood profile. As this shows some depth and has tannins to lose, it may benefit from aging another year. The tart fruit and good acidity make it a good choice to pair with lamb or other fatty meats. Drink now–2005+. —M.M.
title: Otanon 1998 Crianza 1998  (Rioja)

description: This Merlot-dominated blend is sourced exclusively from the Stillwater Creek Vineyard. The entry-level red blend from Baer, it's a broad, spicy, somewhat peppery wine, reflecting the cooler vintage and northern site. The listed alcohol does not show in the palate, which tilts a little toward the green side, and falls away rather quickly.
title: Baer 2010 Star Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: High in acidity, as Sangiovese tends to be, this wine also has the light, delicate mouthfeel of Pinot Noir. The alcohol gives it some body and heat, while the flavors veer toward black cherries. It's a good, interesting wine, although a bit rustic. Won't age, so drink now with rich Italian fare.
title: Soquel Vineyards 2010 Luna Matta Vineyards Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

description: Crisp black plum and cherry flavors are pleasant, if a tad underripe, on this full-bodied SheNAdoah Valley Cab Franc. Striking acidity and an abundance of green, herbal notes give it a lean, slightly tart midpalate.
title: Veramar 2010 Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)

description: Picked in November, the late harvest grapes make up this rich wine, with honey and ginger flavors along with light, dancing acidity that gives the wine great poise. Great with pâtés or terrines.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2011 Saint-Albert  (Pacherenc du Vic Bilh)

description: Aromas of plum, violet and a whiff of spice emerge on this extremely simple red. The short diluted palate suggests red cherry and a hint of vanilla alongside frail tannins.
title: Castorani 2014 Le Paranze  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)

description: Quite distinct from its Single Wheel companion bottlings, there's a rustic, slightly savory tone to pressed apple and pear flavors in this off-dry Riesling. It's light bodied and spry with a brisk, lemony finish.
title: Single Wheel 2013 Third Spoke Patrician Verona Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Fresh and friendly, this medium-bodied, no-frills red delivers layers of blackberry, black currant, ground black pepper and a note of dried sage. It's easy drinking, with bright acidity and round, chewy tannins.
title: Fabrizio Dionisio 2013 Castagnino Syrah (Cortona)

description: Merlot makes up 45% of this wine, with the rest Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Sangiovese, Petit Verdot, Syrah, Zinfandel, and Tempranillo. Aromas of green herb, plum, freshly hewn wood and coffee are followed by smooth-drinking fruit and barrel flavors, with the tannins showing a touch of astringency.
title: Waterbrook 2014 Mélange Founder's Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The wine is just off dry, with a soft tropical-fruit character. It has pineapple as well as lemon fruit, crisp acidity and dried apricot flavors. The wine is crisp at the end, and ready to drink.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Petit Manseng-Sauvignon White (Vin de France)

description: This is a light, leafy wine, with tannins that taste of green tea and leave a sensation of astringency long after the wine is swallowed. Sounds like Burgundy! In a world where so many Oregon wineries are making Pinot Noir that is superripe, extracted and alcoholic, this shows why the Burgundy comparison is still valid.
title: Capitello 2005 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A rough and tumble blend of Tempranillo, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. It starts out with forceful, cheesy oak that gives way to dark plum, bramble and oak-resin flavors, while the finish shows tannin and tomato leaf flavors. It's full, tough and different from all the polished, international wines that dominate the marketplace.
title: Tagonius 2002 Crianza Red (Madrid)

description: Yellow tinted, which announces that this wine was barrel aged. And that barrel character is huge on the nose, which smells of raw oak, vanilla and dried cheese. Feels creamy, but the acidity is lively as well. Shows flashes of brilliance but also fights to absorb all the wood that's been thrown at it. A quality wine but definitely not for everyone.
title: O. Fournier 2009 Alfa Centauri Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)

description: Berry fruits and dense red jelly flavors are the hallmark of this wine. It is full, although edging on stalky, its black berry flavors mixed with acidity and dry tannins.
title: Château Sainte Barbe 2008 Merlot  (Bordeaux)

description: Full in the mouth, the wine has ripe pear and lime flavors. It has a funky edge to it as well, with more rustic flavors. Give the wine six months to come together. Screwcap.
title: Pleil 2012 Classic Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)

description: This is a bright and approachable wine, with forward notes of blueberry, plum and wild strawberry accented by hints of garrigue and vanilla. Swaths of mocha and sweet spice add richness to the palate and linger on the medium-length finish.
title: Domaine Grier 2009 Odyssea Red (Côtes du Roussillon)

description: Candied, dark and murky on the nose, then narrow, clampy and tannic in the mouth. Flavors are herbal, while the fruit content is sweet blackberry and black plum. Short and hollow on the finish, which leaves a grapey residue.
title: Bodega Carmine Granata 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: While this foamy rosé is not elevated, it should appeal to those who like sweet Moscato bubblies. Candied flavors of raspberry, lychee and dried mango finish with a note of pineapple syrup.
title: Tussock Jumper 2013 Moscato Rosé (Valencia)

description: Sweet blackberry aromas veer toward kirsch and crème de cassis, while the palate is perfectly ripe and solid, with medium-deep berry flavors and lots of chalky grab to the fairly tannic finish. For a young, basic Toro wine, this exhibits modest signs of elevation and class.
title: Bodegas Fariña 2006 Spada  (Toro)

description: This is the entry-level wine from this quality estate. It is simple, fruity and ripe with attractive red fruits. Brightly crisp, it is ready to drink.
title: Château des Bormettes 2016 Cuvée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)

description: Woody, toasty oak notes shade aromas of apple and lemon on this sparkling Chardonnay. Bristling lemon-lime acidity helps to balance out a foam of rich, thick, expansive bubbles.
title: Château Frank 2008 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)

description: This soft, easy-going wine smells like chocolate and tastes like plums. Though full bodied, it's very light on tannin and acidity, so the mouthfeel is smooth and rich.
title: Berryessa Gap 2014 Zinfandel (Yolo County)

description: Fresh and creamily fruity, this well-made, balanced wine features a touch of honey and almonds as well as bright, crisp acidity. The 100% Chardonnay in the wine gives a ripe and round aftertaste.
title: Domaine du Vieil Orme NV Gabriel Brut Chardonnay (Crémant de Loire)

description: Whiffs of dark-skinned fruit, blue flowers and game take shape in the glass. The palate is rather diluted and not very expressive, offering subdued hints of black cherry and a note of pepper alongside fleeting tannins.
title: Capoverso 2013 Syrah (Cortona)

description: A wine that is all about crispness, with its green apple slices, pink grapefruit and lime flavors. The sweet acidity gives it shape.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Portada White (Estremadura)

description: In its youth, this Bordeaux blend is dry and a little harsh, with a green, minty edge to the cherry fruit and oak. The acidity accentuates the tannins, which give the wine a hard finish. Not going anywhere, so drink now.
title: Hahn 2005 Meritage (Central Coast)

description: There's a touch of pungent apple skin at first, but the bouquet opens up over time with pretty floral tones and shadings of forest fruit and dried raspberry. For an Amarone, this wine is surprisingly bright and crisp on the close.
title: Giuseppe Lonardi 2007  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Warm and ripe, this is a full-bodied rosé that has the weight and some of the tannins of a red wine. With its vivid pink color and sweet strawberry fruits, it's fruity and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2013 Alandra Rosé (Alentejano)

description: Grown on gravel terraces that rise up from the Loire, this wine is both structuredand fruity. Fresh juicy black currant flavors bring acidity along with them, leaving a light tannic structure at the end. Drink now.
title: Domaine Damien Lorieux 2014 Graviers Cabernet Franc (Bourgueil)

description: Sweet and simple, with buttered popcorn, orange and pineapple juice and caramel flavors.
title: Picket Fence 2009 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Moscato is a great value, a perfect opening for a big party. Made in a subtle, lightly sweet style, with sophisticated gardenia and white flower scents on the nose. A jazzy midpalate mineral note contributes some edge, while the elegant finish trails off into intriguing notes of fresh ginger and roasted pineapple. Drink up, no reason to age.
title: Neirano 2008 Pitulé  (Moscato d'Asti)

description: A widely distributed wine that'll please in yeasty strawberry and blueberry flavor and a yeasty nose. Soft and straightforward, the tannins are tamed and the profile more juicy than earthy.
title: Spellbound 2012 Petite Sirah (California)

description: Vintner Gianni Zonin was instrumental in pushing for the enlargement of the Prosecco production zone and this wine is made under the terms of those new rules. It's an easy, informal apéritif wine with aromas of dried hay and citrus.
title: Zonin NV Cuvèe 1821  (Prosecco)

description: Inviting berry and dark plum aromas are matched by spice notes and depth. The palate feels ripe and full, maybe a touch scratchy, with generous flavors of berry fruits, licorice and toast. For a value wine this shows intensity and good flavors.
designation: Para Celsus Made with Organically Grown Grapes
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Bodegas Navarro López 2011 Para Celsus Made with Organically Grown Grapes Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Aromas of ripe yellow stone fruit and a whiff of nut carry over to the pleasant easygoing palate along with a hint of mature apricot. It's simple but well made, closing on a bitter-almond note.
title: Melini 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

description: Bright cherry and mellow menthol flavors dance on a smooth but firm texture of light tannins in this full-bodied wine. A cedary, minty character lasts into the finish.
title: Weibel Family 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)

description: The wine, unusually 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, is ripe and juicy with some smoky tannins in support. It has a finely perfumed character although touches of extraction give it a bitter edge. That should blow by, leaving an attractive fruity wine.
title: Château la Freynelle 2014  Bordeaux

description: The oyster and clam shell aromas are briney to say the least. The palate is acidic and scouring, with lime, lemon and green melon flavors. It turns pithy on the finish, then a little bitter.
title: Lagar de Costa 2010 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

description: Pithy and citrusy on the nose, but ultimately it's rather neutral. The palate is citric and lean, with orange, lemon and sour apple flavors. Zesty to the point of tartness, with a citrusy, juicy finish. A pointed SB with zing.
title: Emiliana 2010 Natura Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)

description: Dark and ominous in color, with a grapy, rustic, smoky nose, this Garnacha is high in acid, rubbery and tannic on the palate. Semisour black-plum flavors finish equally tannic and acidic.
title: Viñedos y Bodegas Pablo 2013 Menguante Garnacha (Cariñena)

description: Plump yellow peach and blossom notes are contrasted by dusty herbal and bramble notes on this slightly savory Pinot Blanc. It's a quiet wine, delicately acidic and featherlight in texture intended for youthful consumption.
title: Glenora 2014 Pinot Blanc (Finger Lakes)

description: The producer has the largest nursery of old grape varieties in southwest France and from it has plucked the Manseng Noir to blend with Merlot. The result is a rich wine with ripe Merlot red fruits that are given a more tannic character with the Manseng. There is a fresh juicy aftertaste that allows it to be drunk now.
title: Producteurs Plaimont 2014 Moonseng Red (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Very sweet, this has honeyed-apricot, orange and vanilla flavors. It's an opulent wine, but as rich as it is, you find yourself wishing it were even sweeter.
title: Ojai 2011 Kick On Ranch Riesling (Santa Barbara County)

description: Comprised 100% of this rare variety, this wine was given time to ferment and age in French oak, half of it new. Ashy red fruit meets a mild structure and considerable tannic grip; only a tiny amount was made.
title: Cerridwen 2012 Moonlight Sonata Abouriou (Russian River Valley)

description: Aromas suggest leafy underbrush, oak, vanilla, espresso and ripe berry. The firm palate delivers dried blackcurrant, cranberry, baking spice and toasted oak alongside rather raspy, drying tannins.
title: Feudo di Santa Tresa 2012 Avulisi Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)

description: Black cherry, cooked fig and prune fruit flavors are set in thick tannins. There's a bitter character similar to dark roasted espresso.
title: Cave B 2011 XXVI Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This acidity-driven wine has a sheer veneer of tannins over thinned red fruit, earth and cocoa powder. With such a light, simple touch, this wine is a good choice for those who usually order white wine.
title: Robertson Winery 2001 Merlot (Robertson)

description: This blend of Castelão has benefited from its touch of Cabernet Sauvignon to give some tannins and structure. It is a ripe wine, full of red berries, plenty of spice and a crisp aftertaste of acidity. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Capoeiro Red (Tejo)

description: Peach and passion fruit aromas lead the way on this sparkler. The frothy palate shows tropical fruit, Granny Smith apple and kiwi alongside racy acidity and brisk, medium-sized bubbles that lend a fun vibe.
title: Il Follo 2014 Villa Luigia Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: An oaky, smooth Tempranillo with understated black cherry and earthy notes, soft and medium-bodied. On the finish, expect vanilla.
title: Fenestra 2009 Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)

description: Good price for a wine this rich and balanced. It's honeyed, with orange and apricot fruit.
title: Murphy-Goode 2011 Pinot Grigio (California)

description: Gemtree places a lot of emphasis on their growing practices, which is wonderful. The fruit, however, sometimes get masked by winemaking technique, and in this case the culprit is oak. The wine is rich and plush, with sweet potpourri spices, ripe blue and red fruit, and oregano, but the oak overpowers. Drink now–2025.
title: Gemtree 2015 Uncut Biodynamic Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: This fruit-driven wine doesn't show the complexity of much lees aging, but satisfies with its clean, refreshing flavors of pineapple, peach and melon. It's light in body and nearly dry.
title: The Lane NV Lois Blanc de Blancs  (Adelaide Hills)

description: Ruio Brut is a simple and clean Prosecco Superiore that offers peach, citrus and crushed mineral. The effervescence is soft and foamy but the finish is dryer than most Italian sparklers from the general Prosecco category.
title: Malibràn 2012 Ruio Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: A streak of tart, citrusy acidity cuts right through this wine, giving the sweet raspberry and cherry flavors a jammy bite. Easy to drink now with a nice lamb chop.
title: Buena Vista 2009 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This wine has a grassy element that won't appeal to all palates, complemented by medium body and citrus, wet stone and peach fuzz flavor. Neutral oak aging keeps it fresh and lively.
title: Kenefick Ranch 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga)

description: Creamy, rich and loaded with apricot and peach, this would pair well with creamy vegetable risotto.
title: Feudo Arancio 2011 Chardonnay (Sicilia)

description: Some of the grapes for this unoaked white come from old vines, as well as some from the Musque clone, making for a tart, linear taste of lemon verbena and sizzling acidity that's somewhat overshadowed by the unctuous texture and full body.
title: Eco Terreno 2015 Cuvée Acero Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

description: This red sources from across three appellations and four varieties, all aged in a mix of French and American oak for one year. That oak imparts a smoky element around thick, concentrated baked fruit and big, lasting tannin weight, showing plenty of leathery tobacco.
title: Aquinas 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County-Lake County)

description: This fruit did not attain full ripeness in 2011, at least as far as this single-vineyard bottling would suggest. It's thin in the mouth, with considerable herbal character. Though balanced in terms of tannin and acid, the finish feels dilute.
title: Columbia Crest 2011 Reserve Wautoma Springs Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Rounded and soft, this is immediately attractive and ready to drink. It has pear-fruit flavors, with a hint of spice and light acidity. Treat this as an apéritif wine. Screw cap.
title: Gustave Lorentz 2009 Réserve Pinot Blanc Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: What Americans need is a good $8 Zinfandel, and what do you know? That's just what this is. Dry as dust but sweet in fruit, with all kinds of savory spices, this is the perfect everyday wine for barbecue. Production was 8,000 cases, so it shouldn't be too hard to find.
title: Oak Grove 2010 Reserve Zinfandel (California)

description: Lots of toasted, smoky, coffee-like aromas and flavors coat the raspberry and tart blackberry core of this medium-bodied wine. It's a bit much in terms of oak, but makes a fun exercise, especially when paired with its sister wine made in American oak.
title: Herzog 2014 Variations French Oak Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: Hard, dark and spicy up front, then clampy, tannic and aggressive feeling, with astringency and bitter, burnt, oaky flavors of black fruits. Finishes hard and tannic, with rubbery heat. A case of more being less; needs to be dialed down.
title: Gardel 2009 Vendimia Especial Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Self-proclaimed to be the only Sagrantino in the Napa Valley (which is probably true), this wine displays varietal character in its smoky leather and its fruit characteristics trafficking in tart cranberry, orange and black cherry. It is light and subtle.
title: Benessere 2012 Estate Sagrantino (St. Helena)

description: Lemon, lime, sulfur and matchstick aromas are solid. This Viura has a standard, fresh, zesty mouthfeel and common flavors of white grapefruit and lime. A minerally, citric finish is crisp and appropriate.
title: Bodegas Muriel 2014 Vendimia Seleccionada Blanco Viura (Rioja)

description: This is old-school Oregon Pinot, with plenty of pepper, wild thyme and hemp scents and flavors. Very tart cranberry fruit anchors the midpalate. Decanting will help to smooth it out.
title: Cubanisimo Vineyards 2012 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The nose on this clear-colored Godello is fresh, spunky and citrusy. The palate is spritzy in feel and juicy, but also kind of cloying and clumsy. Flavors of sweet apple, citrus, lychee and mango finish tropical and candied, with weight and flatness.
title: Gancedo 2011 Capricho Val de Paxariñas Godello (Bierzo)

description: Offered in a 100ml travel size, with fruit sourced from both the Russian River Valley and Sonoma Valley, this is a worthy companion when pocket size is important. Light citrus and green apple show on the nose before an oaky palate of buttered toast enters the fray.
title: FlyWine 2014 The LayOver Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe yellow fruits dominate this full wine. Balanced by apple freshness, it offers rich apricots and creamed pear, backed by acidity. It's simple, fruity and delicious now.
title: Louis Max 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: Blended from Petite Sirah, Syrah and Barbera, this is a hearty red wine that's tannic and jammy, with a honeyed finish. It's fine with burgers.
title: Rhiannon 2012 Red (Napa Valley)

description: Fruity and bright, this is a lightly textured wine. With lemon and pink-grapefruit flavors dominant and a pale color, it is the crispest possible interpretation of a rosé. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Château Chapelle d'Aliénor 2015 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)

description: Lively and fresh with medium aromatic intensity, here's an all-Italian Riesling executed in a delicate, feminine style. It shows sharp, focused lines of citrus, white flower and stone fruit.
title: Kupelwieser 2010 Riesling (Alto Adige)

description: This wine is stalky with wild blackberry fruits and spicy acidity. It has a crisp edge, with a fresh character that comes through the herbal tannic flavors. It is all youth and fruit, so will be better from 2016. Chill lightly before drinking.
title: Les Rocailles 2014 Saint-Jean-de-la-Porte Mondeuse (Vin de Savoie)

description: One of the many chateaus with vines on the wide valley floor of the Dordogne, this estate has made a lightly extracted wine that has chocolate as well as blackberry stalkiness. There's freshness as well, with fruit acidity that cuts through the mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Château la Chapelle Despagnet 2011  Saint-Émilion

description: Red berry, baking spice and scorched earth aromas waft from the glass of this straightforward red. The easygoing palate offers red berry, cinnamon and a gamey note alongside smooth but rather fleeting tannins. It's at its ideal drinking window so drink now.
title: Mirus 2011  Maremma Toscana

description: A heavier, more vegetal style of Sauvignon Blanc, with aromas of alfalfa and peas. It's a struggle to find much ripe fruit in this wine, and instead it rests on flavors of melon, canned peas and bell pepper. A bit soft in texture as well.
title: Miguel Torres 2008 Santa Digna Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)

description: Aromas of nearly overripe black fruit mingle with accents of exotic spice. The palate delivers a flavor reminiscent of raspberries soaked in spirit, along with hints of cinnamon and white pepper. This offers lovely fruit, but it's a bit shy on length.
title: Le Marognole 2009 I Corsi  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso)

description: Earthy notes mix in with fresh Mirabelle plum notes and juicy apples. The palate is fresh, bouncy and light. Drink soon.
title: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Collection Pinot Blanc (Alsace)

description: Released young, this fresh and citrusy wine is all about the fruit. Full in the mouth, it quickly settles into a cherry vanilla mid-palate, and sails on through a clean finish.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2011 Whole Cluster Fermented Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Deliciously ripe in raspberries, cherries and plums, with an exotic coating of sweetly caramelized oak. The texture is fine and silky, but ultimately the wine is too sweet and simple.
title: Fog Crest 2009 Laguna West Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Fairly light in aromas, this bottling shows red cherry and raspberry fruit lifted with an herbal edge of crushed thyme. The palate is also dainty in flavors, clinging to wet slate and cement minerality more so than fruit, although touches of cranberry and hibiscus notes do arise.
title: Nielson by Byron 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a gentle, creamy wine. Almond and quince flavors are spread generously over the ripe texture. Drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2013 Buissonier  (Montagny)

description: Oak sticks out on this wine, with a buttered-toast note dominating the modest underlying fruit. There's also an herbal quality, which is sometimes found in Napa Valley Chardonnays.
title: Joseph Cellars 2010 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Pretty brawny. It's a tough, chewy wine, with searing acidity and strong tannins. Even with polished cherry, red currant and cola flavors, this wine is rustic. Drink with barbecue and rich Italian fare to cut through the dryness.
title: Artezin 2008 Charbono (Napa Valley)

description: Not an abundance of fruit here but the nose does show some nice minerality while a few gooseberry hints emerge in the mouth. The palate is on the watery side but is redeemed by some nice pear character that lingers on the finish. Drink up.
title: Croteaux 2007 314 Rosé Clone Select Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Barrel fermented and aged for 14 months in French oak, this enters with a nutty, toasty flavor around lighter fruit. Jicama, apple and white peach combine in the midpalate, then thin out quickly, with some bite to the finish.
title: Soléna 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: One of Portugal's priciest table wines, this vintage boasts cherry and plum aromas that just don't seem all that intense, followed by bright cherry flavors accented by modest cedar. The long finish is evidence of its quality, but it turns astringent and one wonders whether the fruit will outlast the tannins.
title: Quinta do Fojo 2000 Fojo Red (Douro)

description: Jammy and fruit forward, this has intense notes of strawberry, blueberry and plum flesh throughout. The lively palate is bright and juicy, ending with an easy, mouthwatering finish. Mevushal.
title: Dovev 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Galilee)

description: This nonvintage Brut is soft, creamy and rounded. It is only lightly textured with its peach and apple fruit flavors and a hint of spice. It is ready to drink.
title: Demarjory NV Cuvée Céleste Brut  (Champagne)

description: Structured and lean this is wine that seems to have lost its fruit. It will likely remain dry because of the tough extraction.
title: Château les Bertrands 2014 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Now in its maturity, the 2006 Tahbilk Viognier shows developed notes of roses, herbal tea and grain while still evincing a youthful expression of fresh pine needles. It's concentrated, broad and viscous with a medium, hay-flavored finish. Drink now.
title: Tahbilk 2006 Viognier (Nagambie Lakes)

description: Slightly oxidized on the nose, this is low on fruit aromas but not unappealing. A plump palate offers flavors of corn, banana and melon. Firm acidity keeps this pumping on the finish.
title: Ochagavia 2013 Gran Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)

description: Benton Lane's reliable, stainless-steel fermented Pinot Gris does not go through malolactic fermentation. The wine is fresh and scented with citrus, grapefruit and wintergreen. Crisp acids lift the palate and add hints of spicy pear. Refreshing and elegant.
title: Benton-Lane 2007 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Briny, leathery, horsey berry aromas are alarming at first but settle in due time. A chunky mouthfeel struggles before finding its timing, while oaky flavors of hickory, bitter char and black fruits finish baked and herbal. This is good but raw, raspy and green.
title: El Molet 2013 Red (Jumilla)

description: Now maturing, this wine still retains some of the freshness of the vintage. It also has spicy blackberry fruits, rich tannins and a full, powerful finish. Drink now, or keep for 2–3 years.
title: Château Saint-Nicolas 2008  Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux

description: Fresh, tart and crisp, this balances its natural acidity against sun-ripened aromas of peach and honeydew.
title: Villa Rubini 2011 Pinot Grigio (Colli Orientali del Friuli)

description: Vanilla, coconut and toast aromas are vibrant and out-front, followed by tropical fruit. This wine is full bodied with a viscous, almost oily feel that persists through the finish. It offers some good things, but the variety gets lost in the style.
title: Browne Family Vineyards 2014 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The 2007 Hickinbotham features attractive scents of ground spices, leather and red cherries, but doesn't seem to have the richness and depth of CH's other Grenaches this year. Tart cherry-berry fruit fades into finely textured tannins on the finish. Drink now–2015.
title: Clarendon Hills 2007 Hickinbotham Grenache (Clarendon)

description: This Brut Prosecco Superiore shows a tight embroidery of white flower, almond and citrus aromas. The wine is simple and clean on the finish with a drying mineral touch on the close.
title: L'Antica Quercia 2012 Matiú Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Light in color and body and modest in alcohol at 12%, this is a curiously intriguing Grenache, tightly wound in freshly picked strawberries and an undeniable earthiness. Aromas lean toward roses with a heavy hint of menthol. A touch of pepperiness on the finish completes the wine.
title: Sheldon 2012 Ceja Farms Grenache (Sonoma Valley)

description: This organic rosé leads with mineral aromas that are framed by fruity notes of yellow peach, melon and green mango. The palate is clean and direct, with attractive vibrancy and freshness that carries through to the softly herbal finish. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Jeanjean 2014 Domaine Le Pive Gris Rosé (Sable de Camargue)

description: Herbaceous and green, this is a crisp wine, still with fresh, tangy fruit after four years. It is light, bright with lemon and green herb flavors and a tight aftertaste. Drink now. This small Roux estate has been in the family for five generations; now guided by Romain Roux. the winery is solar powered.
title: Château Laforêt 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Firesteed's value-oriented Pinot is a solid and reliable wine that varies little from vintage to vintage. Flavors of rhubarb and strawberry are set in place with a touch of vanilla wafer. Don't cellar this. It's ready to go.
title: Firesteed 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
